Description:
Coventry Foodbank has been serving the city by feeding tens of thousands of people in need for over 10 years. 

Since 2011, our operations have grown considerably. Today, our 25,000 square foot distribution warehouse in Binley, supports 13 foodbank centres located in churches around the city and a growing number of local community supermarkets.

Hundreds of volunteers are involved in providing emergency food parcels and signposting the city's most vulnerable citizens to specific support providers. 

We're joining with Coventry Leofric Lions Club in their "100 Challenge" event to raise funds for Coventry Foodbank.

We have a small team of volunteers completing their "100 Challenge" by walking, running or cycling 100 miles during May. 

Many thanks for your support.

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit the SVP Heywood Foodbank JustGiving page.

Since the start of the pandemic, numbers attending the SVP Heywood Foodbank have risen by over 50%. Furlough, redundancies, delays in benefits and home schooling have given rise to families and individuals using foodbanks. During the initial lockdown in March 2020 and as we approached Christmas, there was an influx of donations from many local businesses and individuals. But now as there begins to be light at the end of the tunnel with vaccines, needy families are forgotten about. The need for foodbanks is still real.
Title: Heywood Foodbank

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our Just Giving page.

We are a group of Strathclyde students raising money for Glasgow SE Food Bank. No one should have to face going hungry and food banks help this issue. The food bank is an amazing charity that helps tackle poverty in their local area. Not only do they offer a three day emergency food supply but they also help their clients with other issues relating to  housing, family and mental health. A simple box of food goes a long way.

We are going to do a 24 hour sponsored fast, attempting to live how the users of the food bank would have to if the food bank did not exist!

Any donations are very much appreciated.

Thank you!!

Description:
The Coronavirus is already having a hugely negative economic and social impact across the UK, whether thatâ€™s job uncertainty or self-isolation preventing many vulnerable people from buying the basic items they need.

South Essex College is at the heart of local communities in Basildon, Thurrock and Southend and surrounding areas. Delivering a range of study programmes to over 11,000 students each year throughout Essex and beyond. We offer a wide range of courses from 16-18 education programmes through to higher education, apprenticeships and adult courses. Together, we are working hard to ensure we have a real, positive impact on the lives of our local communities. We have the resources and the fantastic staff to make it happen which is why we have joined forces with London & South East Education Group to support the FE Food Bank Friday initiative.

With more staff and students working and studying remotely and staying home, we have joined this fundraising campaign to support food banks and help ensure they can continue looking after our communities, despite social distancing.



We're raising money for the Trussell Trust, a national charity which supports more than 1,200 food bank centres across the country including several right here in South Essex.



We are asking our amazing staff and college communities to help us by consider donating what they can to ensure we all can come through this crisis. Together, we are stronger.



Thank you so much.

Title: South Essex College supporting FE Foodbank Friday

Description: No one in our community should have to face going hungry. Thatâ€™s why Chesterfield Food Bank provide three daysâ€™ nutritionally balanced emergency food and support to local people who are referred to them in crisis. They are part of a nationwide network of foodbanks, supported by The Trussell Trust, working to combat poverty and hunger across the UK. The Chesterfield foodbank is a registered charity that was started in June 2013. It is a franchisee of the Trussell Trust, (420 foodbanks across the UK) and provides emergency food packs for people in crisis. The foodbank has three distribution centres at Brimington, Loundsley Green and West Bars, a small warehouse at Sheepbridge and a van. The foodbank van is used to transport donated food from drop bins in supermarkets, churches and libraries to their warehouse. Volunteers at the warehouse weigh and sort the food into group and â€˜best before dateâ€™ order, organise the sorted food into cardboard trays, and load it into pallets. The food is picked at the warehouse and delivered to the centres

Title: Bracknell Foodbank

Description:
On the 15th November 2016, I will commence a 24 hour fast in aid of the Trussell Trust. The rules are simple.

1) During this time, I can consume no food, only water, not even coffee! 

2) I will stick to my regular routine as much as possible to show a spirit of solidarity with people living with food poverty, who have to carry on living their lives regardless of this insecurity.

3) I will narrate my experience by regularly updating my Twitter feed throughout the day to remain accountable to people who have kindly donated.

This effort is partly due to the benefits cap which comes into force today, 7th November 2016. The explicit aim of this policy is to 'incentivize' unemployed people into work [http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-37873922]. It is ideologically motivated, responding to the myth that being on benefits is a lifestyle choice, and will disproportionately affect single mothers and larger families as a result [http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/families-set-to-lose-100-a-week-under-chilling-new-benefit-cap-theresa-may-george-osborne-a7401681.html]. According to the Institute for Fiscal Studies, savings made from this measure are likely to be offset by emergency hardship payments made to those struggling to pay their rent [http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/11/07/new-cap-on-benefit-payments-will-only-result-in-trivial-savings/].

My day of willingly foregoing food is nothing compared to the food insecurity and poverty that thousands of people are forced to undergo on a regular basis. The benefits cap will erode the physical and mental health of individuals and families, including those who are already suffering, and represents a shocking assault on human dignity. Clearly, food banks are not a whole solution to this issue. However, they can offer two powerful sustenances: food and hope.

If you decide not to donate to this page or are not able to at this time, please consider adding a couple of extra items to your weekly shop in future and donating them to your local food bank. Information on UK food banks and more on the Trussell Trust's activities can be found here: https://www.trusselltrust.org/

Thank you.

Description:
The last few months have seen immense suffering and hardship from storms and flooding. However the outbreak of the Coronavirus has quite literally changed everyones lives and turned society upside down.However, The Salvation Army is resolute and strong and just as we did in the Spanish Flu pandemic, and during the bombing and the Blitz we will carry on, doing what we can to support people and communities in the ways that we can, within the Government guidelines.In true Salvation Army Spirit, our greatest strength is our flexible, responsive local presence. Right now, each of our 650 corps and community centres will know exactly what the most effective things are to do. We are not just responding to the virus impact in one or two ways, but dozens and dozens of different ways, from food banks to counselling, from supporting NHS isolation units to checking up on people who are living alonePlease give what you can to enable us to help as many people as possible!

We have today 8th June 2020 raised our target from Â£1,250 to Â£2,000.00. Since the start of Covid19 we have (through referrals) helped 64 households (over 150 adults and children) with food parcels. Some families after 10 weeks of this pandemic are on their 3rd or 4th food parcels. So your giving has been a real help and made the difference between them being able to feed the family or go hungry. Thankyou seems such an inadequate word, but thank you to all those who have given.
Title: Tadcaster's Foodbank appeal

Description:
Sneinton Salvation Army is all about experiencing community as a family and understanding what home and freedom looks like in life, community and faith.

Sneinton Salvation Army runs a Foodbank in partnership with Hope Nottingham. We provide food on a regular basis to people who live below the breadline in society. Though this need was very much there before the Covid-19 outbreak it will continue to grow as people face more uncertain futures regarding employment and health. 

We would love it if you could support us as we support others. 




The Salvation Army is a Christian Church & registered Charity working in 130 countries worldwide and is one of the largest and most diverse providers of social welfare in the world. In the UK and Republic of Ireland this work includes more than 800 Salvation Army social service centres and community churches. We provide unconditional friendship, support and very practical help to people in crisis and need and work with children, homeless people, all adult victims of modern slavery and those dealing with drug and/or alcohol addiction.
Title: Sneinton Salvation Army Foodbank

Description:
Our vision is for a UK without the need for food banks.

We say this because itâ€™s not right that anyone cannot afford their own food. Thatâ€™s why we are working towards a just, compassionate future, where no one should have to use a food bank to get by.

Our vision is ambitious, but we know that if we work together it is possible. We can create a future where nobody goes hungry, because nobody will allow it â€“ when we work Together for Change.

#TogetherForChange

Description:
Over 300,000 people in the UK are either homeless or living in inadequate accommodation. 94% of homeless people are unemployed, 72% have some sort of mental health illness and 56% have a long standing physical impairment. So homelessness, either leads to or is the cause of mental and physical illness. This impacts on an individualâ€™s ability to find employment and pull themselves out of poverty which in turn creates a perpetual cycle of deprivation.

Since 2012, As-Suffa Outreach have been working in the homeless space. To date weâ€™ve served over 200,000 hot meals to the homeless across the UK, alhamdulillah. We provide not only food in the form of a freshly cooked hot meal, but also a warm and welcoming environment.

By Allahâ€™s grace, we are now operating in 8 cities across the UK:

â€¢ Birmingham
â€¢ Walsall
â€¢ Coventry
â€¢ Leicester
â€¢ Sheffield
â€¢ Bolton
â€¢ Liverpool

Last year alone we served 40,000 meals across these sites.  This Ramadhan we'll be serving freshly cooked meals EVERYDAY from our Birmingham and Walsall sites.


How you can help:

Our service relies upon your support. Donate here to support the Homeless & Foodbank Projects.

Description:
Thank you for supporting S6 Foodbank. This time last year I could only walk a few steps due to a dodgy heart. Hooray for the NHS - I had my surgery and now I can walk a few miles every day. 

Every donation made goes directly to support their work. Without the assistance of people and businesses in Sheffield, S6 Foodbank wouldn't be able to continue to support their guests, launch new sites and tackle the ongoing food crisis in Sheffield which is being exacerbated by coronavirus.S6 Foodbank are expecting the increased need to continue for the foreseeable future, as more people experience difficulty as a result of coronavirus and its wider consequences. I believe that nobody in Sheffield should have to face going hungry. A donation of Â£27 provides food and basic essentials for a family of three for three days. I am aiming to raise at least Â£40 to help S6 Foodbank reach their Â£40,000 target. Whatever I raise (up to that target) will be match-funded by the Government via the Love Your Neighbour partnership, meaning S6 Foodbank receives double the amount.Thank you for sponsoring me, and a huge thank you too from Chris and the team
Title: S6 Foodbank

Description:
We exist to ensure that no one in Waterloo goes hungry.

For people on low incomes, a sudden crisis  redundancy, benefit delay, illness or even an unexpected bill  can mean going hungry. Every day parents skip meals to feed their children and people are forced to choose between paying the rent or eating.

Since our launch weve given away over 100 tonnes of food to over 12,500 people in need, including almost 5,000 local children.

We are part of The Trussell Trusts UK-wide foodbank network, and together we provide food to thousands of people nationwide every year. The Foodbank is hosted at the Oasis Centre, St Johns Waterloo and St George the Martyr on behalf of South Bank Churches.

We work with local frontline care professionals, such as schools, charities, housing associations, GPs, health visitors and churches, to identify those in need. They distribute vouchers that the client then exchanges for food. When clients arrive at the Foodbank, we offer them the chance to meet with
Title: Waterloo Foodbank

Description:
"Let's do something to bring a smile to a hardworking team at the end of a tough year," said someone at the top Law School in the UK.

"And do something meaningful at the same time."

So, inspired by Marcus Rashford, we wrote a song. We recorded our videos. The editing elves mixed everyone's contributions. And 'Feed the Food Banks' was born.

So, here we are. Lawyers for Food Banks. Please support us and the Trussell Trust's campaign to stop hunger in the UK.

We have humiliated ourselves on video. That's got to be worth something hasn't it? Like the Secret Santa money you haven't spent ... or the drinks you didn't buy during lockdown ... or just because it's the right thing to do!

Title: Lisburn Foodbank

Description:
We exist to ensure that no one in Waterloo goes hungry.

For people on low incomes, a sudden crisis redundancy, benefit delay, illness or even an unexpected bill can mean going hungry. Every day parents skip meals to feed their children and people are forced to choose between paying the rent or eating.

We are part of The Trussell Trust, the UK-wide foodbank network. We work with local frontline care professionals, such as schools, charities, housing associations, GPs, health visitors and churches, to identify those in need.

During the COVID-19 pandemic, referrals to our foodbank are up 135% and we are providing food to hundreds of families each week.

We are currently offering a delivery service to every person who is referred in to our foodbank. This new way of operating comes at additional cost to us, so we are very thankful for any donations, to ensure non-one in Waterloo goes hungry.

Description:
We exist to ensure that no one in Waterloo goes hungry.

For people on low incomes, a sudden crisis  redundancy, benefit delay, illness or even an unexpected bill  can mean going hungry. Every day parents skip meals to feed their children and people are forced to choose between paying the rent or eating.

Since our launch weve given away over 100 tonnes of food to over 12,500 people in need, including almost 5,000 local children.

We are part of The Trussell Trusts UK-wide foodbank network, and together we provide food to thousands of people nationwide every year. The Foodbank is hosted at the Oasis Centre, St Johns Waterloo and St George the Martyr on behalf of South Bank Churches.

We work with local frontline care professionals, such as schools, charities, housing associations, GPs, health visitors and churches, to identify those in need. They distribute vouchers that the client then exchanges for food. When clients arrive at the Foodbank, we offer them the chance to meet with
Title: Waterloo Foodbank

Description:
In these difficult times, lets look out for one another. Food banks will become ever more important this winter, any donations will go directly to New Hope Food Bank who help support those in need of a proper meal.

This November I will be going vegetarian to raise money for the New Hope Food Bank. As a lot of you will know I very much enjoy eating meat so this month will be a challenge, yet a good opportunity to discover some tasty vegetarian meals that will inevitably reduce my meat consumption! Joining me on this challenge are Libby,Tom &Tan, with my parents doing every other day as veggie!

Along with going Vegetarian Andrew and I will be participating in Movember.

Any support and donations will be very much appreciated ( As will good veggie recipes...). Whatever you can give will really make a difference.

Many thanks,

Dan

Nailsea Foodbank has been running since 2013 to provide emergency food to local people.  We also provide support to help people resolve the crises they are facing so that they donâ€™t need to use a foodbank again in the future. Description:
Some of my students and colleagues have challenged me to complete a Ramadan-style day of fasting at the same time that they are fasting every day.

On Friday 23rd I will be fasting from 5.50am until 20.25 that evening.

Please sponsor me to raise money for a foodbank  

Stockport Foodbank operates from six centres across Stockport, providing food to people in crisis.
Title: Gemma's day of fasting for a foodbank

Description:
It is no secret to say that Covid-19 has made 2020 one of the toughest years! But it has hit our foodbanks especially hard, with the UK seeing an 87% increase in foodbank usage this summer. 112% more children are now needing accessing this service than last year. 

With this information we as a team are hoping to raise money for the Glasgow South West Foodbank, that sees nearly 9000 people every year. The increase in demand for their help of food parcels and toiletries has nearly doubled but they don't have enough resources to keep up. We will be challenging ourselves everyday from now until Christmas Eve to raise money by doing sponsored activities and we  really hope that we can smash our target of Â£500 with everyones help.

Please help us - the people of Glasgow, our community, really need the services that the SW Foodbank provide. 

WE SMASHED THE Â£500 TARGET IN FOUR (YES, FOUR!!!) DAYS, LET'S SEE IF WE CAN REACH Â£1000 BY CHRISTMAS EVE! THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR ALL YOUR DONATIONS!
Title: Help Glasgow Foodbanks!

Description:
The Coronavirus is already having a hugely negative economic and social impact across the UK, whether thatâ€™s job uncertainty or self-isolation preventing many vulnerable people from buying the basic items they need.

Barnet and Southgate College is a large further education college in north London, with four campuses across the boroughs of Barnet and Enfield.

We are proud to be part of our local communities, and we work hard to ensure we have a real, positive impact on the lives of our local residents.
In these difficult times, therefore, we are raising money for the Trussell Trust, which operates food banks in Colindale, north Enfield and Chipping Barnet - areas close to our campuses.


As more staff and students are advised to work and study remotely, it is becoming difficult for staff and students to physically donate any items. That is why we have joined this fundraising campaign, which aims to raise Â£2,500 so that our food banks can continue to operate despite social distancing taking place across the country. 


We are asking anyone willing during this extremely tough period to consider donating what they can to ensure that we all can pull through this crisis together.


Thank you so much for your kind donation.
Title: Barnet and Southgate College supporting #FEFoodBank Friday

Description: The KHS staff managed to raise Â£2k during April 2020 for the Kirkcaldy Foodbank.  Together, the whole KHS community raised another Â£1000 in May - Â£3000 so far!  If you can, please donate a bit to help folk who are struggling in our local community.

Description:
Shepton Mallet Salvation Army is collecting donations to buy food for vulnerable people in our community who are struggling during the coronavirus pandemic. Demand for our foodbank has increased by over 800% since the start of the Covid-19 pandemic.  Food donations from the public aren't enough to meet demand, and we're working in supermarkets and our divisional HQ to supply regular quantities of exactly what's needed to issue fully stocked food parcels. 

Â£25 can provide a box of essentials for a family of 4. 

Â£12 can provide a bag of essentials for an individual.

A donation of any amount is welcomed, any money you donate on our Just Giving page comes to us directly in Shepton Mallet Salvation Army and will be spent on keeping our community foodbank running.

Description:
In the UK, more than 14 million people are living in poverty â€“ including 4.5 million children.

Itâ€™s heart-breaking at any time, but no more so than at Christmas.

I currently make a monthly donation to national food bank charity The Trussell Trust, and Iâ€™ll be adding to it in December, but I really want to try and do more.

Title: Support Foodbanks this Christmas

Description:
The past terrible eighteen months has left thousands of people facing poverty, unemployment, homelessness, loneliness and grief. For many the Salvation Army is the only friend they have. We will never stop doing all we can to help people in desperate need by giving them food, shelter, practical support and friendship and yet we cannot do this alone. As a charity we need your support more than ever to keep our vital services running.

Every year the Salvation Army in Chippenham takes part in the Salvation Army Big Collection, raising vital funds to the wider work of the Salvation Army across the UK. We normally spend the beginning of September delivering Big Collection envelops to homes around Chippenham and collecting them back in with your amazingly kind donations! 

This year as a Corps we do not feel it is right for us to knock on doors to collect the envelopes back in. We are conscious that in the current climate additional visitors to the door in close proximity will be an uncomfortable experience. We are, therefore, taking a different approach! Envelopes will still be delivered and we are asking that they either be sent back to us here at the Salvation Army in Chippenham or they can be posted back to Salvation Army Headquarters using the free post envelope. Our Just Giving page details are also included so that donations can be made through this page and we have taking to step to increasing our just giving target by Â£5000! 

We are so grateful for the support we have received from the people of Chippenham over this last 18 months both financially and through well wishes and moral support. Without the support of people in our towns and city the work of the Salvation Army would not be able to happen, every penny you give is used to change the life of someone in need so thank you!
Title: Chippenham Salvation Army Appeal

Description:
Hove Salvation Army have been helping the poorest in our neighbourhood for almost 140 years, in the early days we delivered bags of coal; more recently, we've been running a foodbank - receiving donations of non-perishable foods and passing them on to those who cannot afford to stock their own cupboards. 

More and more people are feeling a reduction in their income and some families whose children normally receive free school meals are finding an extra squeeze on their purse; added to this - the means by which good people can supply us with food has closed down. Other food banks in our neighbourhood have closed down, so we're facing an increasing demand with no more supplies!  We cannot ask you to drop food off to us.  But with your generous giving, we can make food orders to re-stock our cupboards and insure that those who cannot afford to buy shopping will be fed.

The Salvation Army is a Christian Church & registered Charity working in 130 countries worldwide and is one of the largest and most diverse providers of social welfare in the world. In the UK and Republic of Ireland this work includes more than 800 Salvation Army social service centres and community churches. We provide unconditional friendship, support and very practical help to people in crisis and need and work with children, homeless people, all adult victims of modern slavery and those dealing with drug and/or alcohol addiction.
Title: Hove's Salvation Army Foodbank

Description:
In these uncertain times foodbanks will be providing a much needed safety net for thousands of people. 

It is undoubtedly appalling that there is food poverty in one of the richest countries in the world, but in lieu of an immediate solution we must do what we can to help. 

Before the current crisis hit Southwark foodbank were running a fundraiser. The aim was to raise Â£2000 in time for Easter, and we think that we can raise this for them! The NHS London branch of UNISON have agreed to match every donation made through this page, up to Â£1000. 

The foodbank in question helps residents of Southwark, the borough in which the majority of our members work. 

This isn't just for members of UNISON however, please share this with anyone you think will be interested, especially colleagues who are based in Skipton House and Wellington House as these offices are in the borough of Southwark. 

If any members based in Stewart House would like to organise something similar for a charity local to your office please get in touch with us on unison.nhslon@gmail.com
Title: UNISON NHS London Branch Southwark Foodbank Fundraiser

Description:
Hamilton District Foodbank, as part of The Trussell Trust network, provides emergency food packs along with essentials like washing powder, nappies and sanitary products to families who are struggling, as well as signposting them to other services in the local area. Many Trussell Trust foodbanks, including Hamilton District Foodbank, are partnering with other agencies to provide additional services such as welfare advice, budgeting help and debt support at the foodbank itself, helping people to break out of crisis.

New figures show 4,015 emergency food supplies given to local people by Hamilton District Foodbank in last year

â€¢ 4,015 three day emergency food supplies given to local people in crisis by Hamilton District Foodbank in 
2016-17 â€“ 1,424 went to children
â€¢ Latest statistics published by The Trussell Trust foodbank network show UK-wide foodbank figures are still not decreasing 
â€¢ Local increase due to people struggling with continued issues with benefit payments and low wages

4,015 three day emergency food supplies were provided to local people in crisis by Hamilton District Foodbank during 2016-17, compared to 2,667 in 2015-16. Of this number 1,424 went to children. The top three reasons for foodbank referral were: benefit delays, low income and benefit changes.

Over the last year, local people have donated 46,676 tonnes of food to Hamilton District Foodbank, and over 75 volunteered. Local schools, businesses and faith groups have provided vital support to the foodbank, enabling us to give three daysâ€™ nutritionally balanced food and support to people in crisis.

Hamilton District Foodbank shares the concerns of other Trussell Trust foodbanks in Universal Credit rollout areas about the adverse side effects the new system can have on people. The 6+ week waiting period for a first payment can contribute to debt, mental health issues and rent arrears. The effects of these can last even after people receive their Universal Credit payments, as bills and debts pile up. Hamilton District Foodbank is working hard to stop local people affected going hungry but is troubled by the extra pressure this puts on food donation stocks and volunteersâ€™ time and emotional welfare.

As well as providing emergency food, Hamilton District Foodbank provides essentials like washing powder, nappies and sanitary products to families who are struggling, as well as signposting them to other services in the local area. Many Trussell Trust foodbanks, including Hamilton District Foodbank, are partnering with other agencies to provide additional services such as welfare advice, budgeting help and debt support at the foodbank itself, helping people to break out of crisis.

Isobel Graham, Foodbank Manager of Hamilton District Foodbank said:

â€œIt is deeply concerning that we are still seeing an increase in the number of three day emergency food supplies provided to local people in crisis in Hamilton District over the last year.

â€œAnybody could find themselves in need of the foodbank. Every week people are referred to us after being hit by something unavoidable â€“ such as illness, a delay in a benefit payment or an unexpected bill â€“ means food is simply unaffordable. It really is only with the communityâ€™s support that weâ€™re able to provide vital emergency help when it matters most, and we hope that one day there will be no need for us in Hamilton District. But until that day comes, we will continue to offer the best possible service to help local people facing a crisis. Thank you so much to everyone in Hamilton District who already donates time, food and money to help local people. If youâ€™re not already involved, weâ€™d love to hear from you!â€

Description:
We are a  group of Hallam School families who want to use this lockdown to fundraise for other other families who are having a hard time during this global pandemic. We know that many families have been hit by bereavement, illness, isolation, job instability and financial hardship. We want to raise money for a charity that works towards ending hunger in our own city and country. 

We would love for Families to walk for Foodbanks in the month of February 2021 at any time that suits them. We are setting our children the challenge of walking a mile or km / year of age! We can help you with routes if you would like it.

Please walk within the governmental lockdown guidelines. We have posted a summary in the updates below.

The Trussel Trust's vision is for a UK without the need for food banks. We say this because itâ€™s not right that anyone cannot afford their own food. Thatâ€™s why we are working towards a just, compassionate future, where no one should have to use a food bank to get by. Our vision is ambitious, but we know that if we work together it is possible. We can create a future where nobody goes hungry, because nobody will allow it â€“ when we work Together for Change.#TogetherForChange
Title: Family Walk for Foodbanks

Description:
Its been a tough year! So, as now has become habit, we are asking you to give a little (or a lot!) to help those who are struggling to put food on the table. 

Its not news that there have been many people who have been hit very hard by the COVID-19 pandemic. Its also not news that some of us have spent a good deal more time on zoom rather than waking up to those pesky bar tab notifications. So heres for a bit of redistribution!

Please give as much as you can this festive period to help raise some money for the Trussell Trust, the UKs biggest network of food banks. For more info on the organisation, here is their website: https://www.trusselltrust.org

Some people love a stat, we know we do. So here are some numbers to help paint the picture:

â€” Between 1 April 2019 and 31 March 2020, the Trussell Trustâ€™s food bank network distributed 1.9 million three-day emergency food supplies to people in crisis, an 18% increase on the previous year. More than 700,000 of these went to children.

â€” The Trussell Trustâ€™s latest research, carried out with Heriot Watt University, estimates 846,000 parcels will need to be provided by the network to people in crisis during October to December 2020 â€“ a 61% increase on last year.

If youâ€™re reading this and youâ€™re thinking, â€™damn, I am one of those people affectedâ€™ then please share this around instead of donating. The more people that see it, the more donations are made!

If youâ€™re thinking, â€™hey, Iâ€™m feeling flushâ€™ then please give generously and share widely as the same applies - the more people that see it, the more donations are made!

Weâ€™re excited for the year when we can say food banks no longer need to existâ€¦ but in the mean time, thank you <3

#ThisCanChange

Title: IMM's Fundraiser for Bognor Foodbank

Description:
At the start of the year Dan Tilke and I decided to set up a company called HAFU which we intended to open after I completed my training at Le Manior aux quat saison. The fundamental idea of the business is to provide healthy affordable food in the takeaway market were the fundamentals of cooking, seasonality and wonderful flavours would be at the for front of everything we do. Transferring the the skills I have learnt and will continue to learn from the incredible chefs I work alongside at Le Manior. Chef Gary Jones told me during my interview at Le Manior that food has the power to create happiness and escape from the world we face, which I've been told from my incredible customers my food has been doing for them. Pursuing my dream of becoming a chef has for the last 18 months of my life has been integral to every life decision I have made and this in turn has given me such incredible happiness, friends and experiences which I'm truly grateful for. 

However, In a turn of events three weeks ago when the country entered lock down, I like so many other chefs had the daunting news that we were no longer were allowed to go into work. This lead to huge worries as I was working on a zero hour contract at Le Manior, the fear I was no longer going to have any stream of income over the next few months hit home hard. So after lengthy discussion with my parents  in the car journey home from celebrating my mothers retirement at Le Manior. The decision was made to start cooking meals for local people in Compton Dando and the surrounding villages to raise some money to cover my essential bills. Over the last three weeks we have been incredibly busy, serving food on 16 of the 21 days of lockdown and selling over 400 meals out of two ovens and 5 burners stove. However, through the incredible generosity of Belmond and the team at Le Manior I have retained 100% of my wage which has meant this money I had been earning was no longer needed. 

Therefore, Like everyone else I have been watching the news every day for updates on the corona virus crisis and one story stood out in particular and that was of the massive rise of need for food banks and the decrease in funding and donations.This lead to phoning up the local food bank in Keynsham (Trussel trust). The discovering news was worrying, they had seen a 1000% increase in people using their service at several collection points in Keynsham and the surrounding area. They had also seen a huge drop in food bank donations and money coming into support their service. Therefore, Dan&I have decided to pledge Â£500 of the money Hafu has earned over the last three weeks towards the Trussel trust and helping those most vulnerable in society.  

If you could donate anything on top of this, it would be hugely appreciated by those most in need. 

Stay safe,

Dan&Will
Title: Hafu foodbank fundraiser

Description:
Hello, my name is Tom and I am 8 years old. I want to raise money to help people who have lost their jobs during covid-19 and do not have enough money for food and drinks.

The Trussell Trust is a charity which helps foodbanks all over the country. Foodbanks provide emergency food for the people that need it. I would like to help the foodbanks by asking my friends and family to donate a small amount of money to the Trussell Trust.

To thank you for your donation I will send you a happy heart or special star.I have created the special stars and happy hearts with clay at home then painted them with bright colours.

If you give some money it is likely that you are basically giving a meal to someone who needs it . Please give just a small amount of money to the foodbanks.

Stay well, love from Tom.
Title: Tom's Foodbank Fundraiser

Description: I myself am a foodbank volunteer, and know the need that the trust has for donations. More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Description:
With another Conservative government we are heading into many more years of food poverty, thanks to the disastrous universal credit system, its 5 week wait period and the Conservative's dehumanising cutbacks of our welfare system.

Since the government won't help the folk who are going to bed hungry tonight I'd like to do what little I can for our community, and hope that you'd join me. 

More information about gateshead foodbank can be found here - https://gateshead.foodbank.org.uk/

Title: Support Gateshead Foodbank

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Long story short we are all aware of how fortunate we are especially on the run up to Christmas. I am just trying to make Christmas a little bit better for those less fortunate.

I currently work at TGI Fridays whilst I complete my Maters degree. Last year I ran a very similar project that was extremely successful. This year I am going to go one step further and I will be donating 100% of the tips I earn on The dates below 

22nd November, 23rd November, 25th November and the 7th December. My team at TGI Fridays are also donating long life food which I will be donating to Manchester Foodbank.

Please this Christmas give whatever you can pennies or pounds to make a difference this Christmas.
Title: Russell's Christmas Foodbank donation

Description:
The coronavirus is already having a hugely negative economic and social impact across the UK, whether thatâ€™s job uncertainty or self-isolation preventing many vulnerable people from buying the basic items they need.

Greater Brighton Metropolitan College is our local college for Worthing, Shoreham and Brighton sitting at the heart of our community. Our brilliant teachers help our learners to transform their lives and we support 16-18 year olds, job seekers, adults, apprentices and undergraduates.

So, when London South East Colleges launched â€˜FE Foodbank Fridayâ€™ we decided to join this initiative. We want to continue to fulfil our role as THE local community college and help those who need it most during this crisis.

But, as more staff and students are advised to work and study remotely,
it is becoming difficult for them to physically donate any items.

Thatâ€™s why we started this fundraising campaign so our local foodbanks can continue to operate despite social distancing taking place across the country.

We are raising money for The Trussell Trust which supports a network of foodbanks providing emergency provisions to those in need, and has foodbanks in Worthing, Shoreham and in Whitehawk, Brighton.

We are asking anyone willing - during this extremely tough period - to
consider donating what they can to ensure that we all can pull through this crisis together.

Thank you so much for your kind donation - it's really appreciated.

#FE Foodbank Friday
Title: Greater Brighton Metropolitan College supporting FE Foodbank Friday

Title: Hizzer's Raising money for foodbanks

CharityName: THE PAROCHIAL CHURCH COUNCIL OF THE ECCLESIASTICAL PARISH OF PRINCES RISBOROUGH WITH ILMER
Description:
My husband and I have started Zoe's Foodbank Challenge to enable us to make a financial contribution to Princes Risborough Food Cupboard. By doing our bit, we hope to help ensure local people facing hardship don't go hungry.

What we are doing: 

We are going to live on the equivalent weekly amount of food as donated by a foodbank.  We will continue this throughout the whole of November 2020.   Using a weekly shopping list for two people,  provided by Princes Risborough Food Cupboard, we will purchase the items for us to live on, with only minimal extras worth Â£1 a day. We are donating all of the money saved, based on our usual weekly spend, to the to this great cause. 

If you would like to make a donation, it would be very much appreciated. 

Princes Risborough food cupboard is a project run by Churches Together in Princes Risborough to help support people in our community facing hardship. Your kind donations will bless and support those who most need it.

Description:
There are times when managing a small front line charity can pretty trying. Covid 19 means over 20000 hungry individuals and families will be arriving at our door looking for emergency food. As sure as night follows day, inflation is going hammer up the price of food and power and already limited means will suddenly be incapable of paying for life's basics.

Demand for emergency food will keep on going up and trying to raise enough cash to make help the people we need to help will continue to get

Council and the Government to help us out. Now it seems the only show
in town for most of the front line charities is the community.

Description: After having amazing support during DJ Livestreams in Lockdown 1, in this unprecedented year, I seek your support to help those who will have a most difficult Winter and Christmas. The idea is great and as the beating heart of the community, it is our job to repeat this in Bury, Rammy and Totty.  This Foodbank is a member organisation of the Independent Food Aid Network and works with Fareshare Go by Foodcloud.

Title: Alistair's NHS Support for Renfrewshire Foodbank

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page. 

Living in Stockport I hope you are aware of the amazing work that Chelwood Foodbank does to help so many families in Stockport. If not here their Facebook page where you can follow them and invite your friends to do so too.
https://www.facebook.com/foodbankstockport  

Coronavirus has hit the service hard, not least because:
- Demand for the service has increased
- Food supply is more limited
- A significant number of the foodbank's volunteers fall into the higher risk brackets
- They have had already had to cancel their fundraising events planned for 25 March and  19 to 27 April.

I have been supporting this charity for the last 7 years and it is completely committed to helping all vulnerable people in our area through this time. 

And with that, comes my plea to you.  Will you join me in supporting this charity?

Can you spare Â£1-2 to help Chelwood continue to keep operating and meeting increasing demands and feed one of the absolutely most vulnerable pockets of society?

The average cost per head of a food parcel is cÂ£20-25. I've set a target of Â£2000 and hope you amazing people reading this page can help me to help up to 100 people in need including families with children.

They don't have back up food supplies of their own in a store cupboard or a freezer and don't have enough money to go out and do their own shopping. Which is why the charity exists. 

All clients helped by the charity have been referred into it by other organisations - such as Citizens Advice, the job centre, GP's Schools etc. 

Thank you for your support
Louise

Description:
So ......todayâ€™s my birthday, nothing unusual in that?   Except, after reading about the challenge that foodbanks face at the moment.   This really touched me.  Instead of buying something I probably didnâ€™t need, I am proud to have helped the West Lothian Foodbank.    I spent my birthday money on something that really matters.   Helping others put food on the table during these challenging times. Going through the isolation perhaps alone, a single parent, someone dealing with illness or perhaps just lost their job, these challenges are immense.   If you are also struggling to put food on the table for yourself and your family I can  only begin to imagine how that must feel.  Just now their demand for food at foodbanks has increased drastically at the time they are receiving vastly lower numbers of food donations.  With some staple food items in short supply, foodbanks need cash to help negotiate a supply of these items directly with supermarkets.    I was so inspired by the post that I want to do a little bit to help as much as I can.   

If you are able to make a donation to help those in need, even Â£1 I would be really proud to make sure everyone in West Lothian has food to help them get through these really tough times.    Thanks - Caroline Garland â¤ï¸

Description:
ï»¿During the COVID-19 lockdown, the impact on the Greenwich Foodbank is already telling. A number of donation points have closed or are not able to operate reliably, and the number of referrals has increased. The clients of the Greenwich Foodbank are referred to them by a number of agencies, and provided with emergency packs which contain three days worth of food.

So, please help us walk, run, cycle and exercise within your lockdown restrictions, to collectively cover the distance from Whippany to Pune via the UK (12,500 Km) and raise money for the Greenwich Foodbank.

To contribute to the race to the finish, just submit yours and your family's
weekly distances by midday each Wednesday to the Citizenship and Community
mailbox.   Every 20 minutes of aerobic exercise for anyone who is currently unable to leave the home or has chosen not to will be counted as 3 Km
to the total.

We've also set ourselves a fundraising target alongside your physical efforts - we're aiming to raise Â£1 for every kilometre travelled.   So any donations
that you can make throughout your journey to help us reach this target and
generate much needed funds for the Greenwich Foodbank during these unprecedented times will be massively appreciated!

Title: Bowdon Vale Local Foodbank

Description:
Hi!  This is a shakedown.

According to the Trussell Trust, they had over 1 million visits to their food banks from people requiring emergency food supplies in one year.  I think this is bonkers.  However, since it's not going anywhere fast, I'd like to donate to the trust to help people, as I'm more fortunate than most.

During December, I will be doing a "reverse advent calendar", adding one item of food or toiletries to a box each day, and taking them to my nearest food bank (Cheltenham) in the new year.

In addition, I would like to raise money for the trust, as apparently whilst supplies are helpful, money can go further.  Just to clarify, the money you donate will not be used to fill my "advent calendar", it will go directly to the charity.

Please, please donate, and I'd encourage you to also take a box to a food bank near you.

Merry Christmas, and a Happy New Year!

Hannah

Title: S6 Foodbank - Donation Appeal

Description:
Hi everyone, I have been volunteering at the foodbank since last year and I have seen the amazing work they do firsthand, now more than ever they need your support. 

The foodbank believes that no one should go hungry and provide nutritionally balanced emergency food and support to people in crisis. 

Where foodbanks across the country have closed during the pandemic, Blackburn Foodbank has remained open and have expanded their service in order to manage the unprecedented number of referrals they have received for people in crisis. 

Please could you donate as much or as little as you can manage, it would be really appreciated.

Thank you,

Samman.


If you would like to find out more about the foodbank see: 

https://blackburn.foodbank.org.uk/ 

Or follow them on Facebook

https://m.facebook.com/BlackburnFoodbank/
Title: Samman's Raising Money For Blackburn Foodbank

Description:
Why am I asking for your money?

My wife and children decided to volunteer at the Kingsbridge Area Foodbank at the start of the Covid-19 outbreak. The children are keen participants in the Malborough and District Kids theatre group and the pantos so they have created a song. You can see their customised version of â€Where is loveâ€ from Oliver here: youtu.be/qBhFYFel4lw to try and persuade you all to donate some money to the Foodbank's cause. Please watch the video and give whatever you can spare to help support families in need.

Who will receive the money

The Kingsbridge Area Foodbank is a wonderful organisation that has been supporting families and individuals for 8 years but lately the demand for their services has soared to new levels. My wife chose to volunteer with the foodbank, while on furlough from her job in Kingsbridge, and has seen the enormous pressure they are suddenly under. I think the numbers of people being helped have jumped from around 25 to 110 per week. They have already had some very kind donations but, as you can imagine, the demand is using up the money fast. To try and raise money my children came up with the idea of singing a song here so please give it a watch and, if you can, donate to this worthwhile cause.

Why you really should care

I wanted to mention one last thing that has really stuck with my wife. when she visited a family recently. The main earner was self-employed and his business had been forced to stop. As you may know, that means the family will not receive support until June. The lady that answered the door ended up in tears as she explained that she never expected to be in this situation. I have to admit it was very moving to hear her story but thank goodness the Foodbank has been able to help. Please help if you can and if, like the lady above, you find yourself in need, get in touch. There is no judgement, they just want to help.

Thank you and stay safe,

Jason, Tamara, Olly and Charlotte
Title: Charity Song for Kingsbridge Foodbank

Description:
Every year ahead of the summer holidays I hold a food collection for the local foodbank at The White Horse and the Co-op where people can donate a handful of tins to prevent local people from going hungry.

Given that the pub is closed and the Co-op is using additional space for social distancing, COVID-19 is going to make this hard.  Having people drop of food donations to my house might well put my own household at risk and with a 3 year old daughter, I can't responsibly do that.

The best thing about collecting food was that people were able to donate a few items for only a small amount but can donate more if they were able to.  So I plan to continue this ethos: I'm not asking for Â£10 or even Â£5.  The minimum donation through JustGiving is Â£2.  If a decent portion of Disley can donate just Â£2, we'd be able to prevent a lot of families from going hungry this year.

If you'd like to donate less - even the change in your pocket - or you prefer to donate offline, message me and I'll let you know my address to drop it off.

Title: BorgWarner Gateshead - Donations to Gateshead Foodbank

Description:
Last year I was overwhelmed by the contributions made to the food bank collection that we collected in the office. When I delivered to the food bank they couldn't believe how many bags we had and this was a great help for those before and after Christmas.

This year it's not possible to arrange a collection ourselves, so instead we have chosen to raise funds for the Trussell Trust. They work with more than 1,200 food banks all across the UK, providing a minimum of three days nutritionally-balanced emergency food to people in crisis. There are more than 14 million people in the UK living in poverty, including 4.5 million children. The Trussell Trust also work with those relying on food banks to help get them out of crisis, with the ultimate goal of no need for food banks at all.

During the pandemic, food banks have been busier than ever, The Trussell Trust is aiming for Â£1million to ensure no one struggles to afford the basics this Christmas and beyond. No contribution is too small, it all adds up and together we can help make this happen!

Our vision is for a UK without the need for food banks. We say this because itâ€™s not right that anyone cannot afford their own food. Thatâ€™s why we are working towards a just, compassionate future, where no one should have to use a food bank to get by. Our vision is ambitious, but we know that if we work together it is possible. We can create a future where nobody goes hungry, because nobody will allow it â€“ when we work Together for Change. #TogetherForChange

Title: Irwell Valley Fasts for a Foodbank

Description:
Will you help us raise Â£5,000 to feed families in need this Christmas?

Breakfast, lunch, dinner. We donâ€™t give a second thought to some meals.

Grabbed on the go, at your desk, at the table, in the kitchen. Sometimes in a restaurant. But what else can your meal do?

It can feed a child. It can help a country-wide network of food banks that want to change the status quo. It can buy food for a family and relief from hunger.

For the price of a meal you can change someoneâ€™s Christmas for the better. And thatâ€™s priceless.

There are more than 14 million people living in poverty in the UK â€“including 4.5 million children - and this Christmas is going to be
particularly difficult for many. 

The Trussell Trust, the UKs largest network of foodbanks, expects a 61 per cent increase in the number of food parcels needed this winter.

Join our campaign â€“ donate the price of a meal

Weâ€™re supporting the Trustâ€™s work and asking if youâ€™ll also help by donating the price of a meal - whether thatâ€™s your lunch or the value of celebratory dinner for two - to a family in need.

About The Trussell Trust

The charity supports a nationwide network of foodbanks and provides emergency food and support to people locked in poverty, campaigning for change to end the need for foodbanks in the UK.

It supports over 1,200 foodbank centres in the UK â€“ 40 in the South West â€“ helping them provide a minimum of three daysâ€™ nutritionally-balanced emergency food to people who have been referred in crisis, as well as support to help people resolve the crises they face.

Between April 2019 and March 2020, foodbanks in its network provided a record 1.9 million food supplies to people in crisis, an 18 per cent increase on the previous year.

Donate now

Choose your option:

Sarnie and a coffee Â£4.50

Cafe brunch Â£9.50

Restaurant lunch Â£19

Slap-up dinner Â£40

Celebratory dinner for two Â£120

Thank you for your kindness.

Title: Gary's Quiz Night for Re:dish Foodbank

Description:
On the 29th November, the Link Market Services Business Development team spent the
day volunteering at the Barking Foodbank, a part of the Trussell Trust's UK
foodbank network run by the Hope Family Trust. 

Our team of 12 spent the day purchasing food for the foodbank where we did a very
competitive trolley dash (think Supermarket Sweep)! Followed by a chilly walk
back to the foodbank in order to help sort the food received from donations.
This involved some heavy lifting and hours of sorting food in to categories
i.e. pasta (a lot of pasta) and soups and then each in to date order. This was
no small task. It was a very fulfilling day which was not only for a wonderful
cause but also a fantastic way to spend time as a team, working hard together.

Barking Foodbank is a life-changing, community-based project tackling food poverty in
the borough of Barking and Dagenham. They help individuals and families in
crisis through the provision of emergency food supplies donated by churches,
schools, local businesses and the general public. We heard stories of ladies
and children escaping abusive partners, people losing jobs etc. as well as
receiving nutritionally-balanced 3 day food parcels, people are welcomed with a cup of tea, listened to, and signposted to agencies that are able to help resolve the underlying cause of the problem. Alongside the foodbank, the Trust also runs a clothes bank and kitchen service for these families and individuals to cater for their basic needs.

Christmas is a season of great generosity and in the spirit of the season, Barking Foodbank hosts individuals and families struggling with feelings of sadness and isolation to a day of fun and festive cheer. 

Held every year since 2014, their annual Christmas party creates a wonderful feeling of happiness and togetherness, lifting up their spirits at what would otherwise be a very difficult time of the year. 

The feedback received during and long after this event energizes the volunteers to keep going with this worthy cause.  The party is planned for the December 22nd with an ambitious target to give out:

  • 250 festive hampers; 
  • 250 whole chicken/turkeys; 
  • Presents for every child who comes; and 310
    coats and jackets. 

Guests will enjoy a well-laid out buffet of hot meals, live music from a band, games, and fun from various entertainers and raffle prizes. The children can bounce to their heartsâ€™ content in the indoor bouncy castle, enjoy face painting and be entertained by a children entertainer.

Our aim is to raise as much money as possible and spread the joy of this season to donate funds to purchase as many chickens and turkeys as possible for this yearâ€™s party guests!

We hope that you can dig deep and give as much or as little  as you possible can in order for us to  support  and contribute toward making Christmas 2017 a memorable experience for over 250  families in our East London borough.

And finally, Merry Christmas!
Title: Barking Foodbank Christmas Donations

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

This Christmas at works I am collecting for the
Manchester Central Food Bank.

The Manchester Central Food Bank is affiliated with the Trussell Trust, an NGO charity working to end hunger in the UK, who work with a number of food banks nationwide. Our local foodbank has been running since 2013 and opens 3 days a week providing emergency food packages to individuals and families in need across Greater Manchester.

I would like to invite any friends & contacts of mine to get involved with the collection, and would welcome any donations you may be able to make. Donations can be delivered in person between 27 Nov-20 Dec to the 24hr residential concierge desk at:

BEETHAM TOWER, 301 DEANSGATE, MANCHESTER, M3 4LQ

There is particular focus on the following items, which are in short supply:

  • UHT milk
  • Tinned fruit & other tinned/jarred foods
  • Cereral
  • Long-life juice
  • Jam & peanut butter

Other donation ideas include pasta, jars of sauce, tea bags, coffee, rice pudding, biscuits, soup and sugar. Donations of personal care items & toiletries, such as toothbrushes, deodorant, face wipes etc are also welcome, as these can often be an added expense to people who are already struggling to make ends meet.

I have set up this page for anybody who isn't able to physically visit to make a donation but would like to get involved. All funds from this page go directly to the Foodbank Charity, so anything you can donate will be greatly appreciated and received with thanks.

Further information for both organisations can be found at: www.manchestercentral.foodbank.org.uk
& www.trusselltrust.org.

Description:
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.

Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Title: Elizabeth's Donations to North Bristol Foodbank

Description:
The last few months have seen immense suffering and hardship from storms and flooding. However the outbreak of the Coronavirus has changed everyone's lives and turned society upside down.


However, The Salvation Army is resolute and strong and just as we did in the Spanish Flu pandemic, and during the bombing and the Blitz we will carry on, doing what we can to support people and communities in the ways that we can, within the Government guidelines.

In true Salvation Army Spirit, our greatest strength is our flexible, responsive local presence. Right now, each of our 650 corps and community centres will know exactly what the most effective things are to do. 

We are not just responding to the virus impact in one or two ways, but dozens and dozens of different ways, from food banks to counselling, from supporting NHS isolation units to checking up on people who are living alone

Please give what you can to enable us to help as many people as possible!
Title: The Salvation Army - Swansea Citadel

Description:
You would have seen in the news that the Government has voted against extending the scheme to supply free school meals for kids as we move into October half term and Christmas. This is not a political statement from the club, we simply recognise that all children deserve to be fed and that whereas many of us are in the position to do that, there are some who are not afforded the same opportunity whether it be because of the pandemic placing their parents out of work or other social issues.

In response we are appealing to our members and beyond to donate towards supporting Blackpoolâ€™s foodbank as we move into the hardest time of the year for those who are less privileged. We would also take this opportunity to encourage people to make food donations as well. Our initial target is Â£500 although it would be great if we can smash through that. Please take the time to think of others this winter and help us support our local community.
Title: Blackpool RUFC Foodbank Donation

Description:
We've all felt the effects of Covid-19 differently. For some of us, it put to a halt our summer plans; for others it meant they haven't seen family in a while. But for many, the loss of employment has meant that they can no longer afford to eat. Additionally, the government's recent decision to end free school meals during holidays in conjunction with the upcoming ending of the furlough scheme, only means that more families, through no fault of their own, may find themselves without food this winter.

With foodbank usage set to rise in the UK by 61% between October and December, I have decided to challenge myself to run a total of 100km throughout November to raise money for the Gateshead Foodbank, an amazing charity that has been providing food for people in the local community.

It would be so great if you guys could donate and help this amazing charity because nobody should have to go to bed hungry. 

I'll be posting regular updates on how the challenge is going!

Thank you so much,

Rudo :)
Title: Running 100km for Gateshead Foodbank

CharityName: Watford Foodbank and Community Relief Trust
Title: 50K Walk For Watford Foodbank

Description: Stockport Foodbank operates from six centres across Stockport, providing food to people in crisis.
Title: MyCSP Fundraising for Stockport Foodbank

Description:
This winter, every nine seconds in the UK, someone in crisis is expected to need an emergency food parcel from a local food bank, a 61% increase on last year. 

However, lockdown and restrictions have meant that food donations have declined, placing extra pressure on these important services. 

We want to help fund local food banks and the emergency food parcels they provide, so we've set up this fundraising page to enable us all to give what we can to this vital cause; every penny counts. 

#ThisCanChange
Title: Making a difference for food banks

Description:
Hi guys, as you know times are tough for a lot of families at this time of the year and we are hoping at raising a bit of money so we can donate it to this fantastic organisation to help buy food, toy etc for families who might find it a struggle and who need our help this Christmas.

Theses are hard times for us all guys and we are each dealing with our own struggles during these trying times, however, If anyone can spare some cash to donate to the guys at Glasgow South West foodbank it will be gratefully received.

I have started with a target of Â£550, and I'm sure we can all appreciate how symbolic the first 2 digits of this number could be this season?  This is our first target, and hopefully we can hit this while we are all up against it this year(for the appeal and you know what) lol

If you are able to contribute, no matter how much you can donate,  we will all be eternally grateful and thankful for any contribution. 

The appeal will run until 31st December.

God bless guys, and lets be thankful for what we have in life!
Title: BMGH's Rangers Rumours Foodbank appeal

Description:
Our family normally gets together for Aunty Silviaâ€™s birthday every Boxing Day. There is food, drink, love and laughter and always a crazy present exchange. We will miss seeing everyone this year, as well as those no longer with us. Still hoping we can still have a virtual celebration but we felt it appropriate to make a donation to Trussel Trust in place of the gift exchange to support those less fortunate. 

Trusses Tryst supports several food banks across Manchester and beyond and their mission is to end hunger. Letâ€™s see what our Boxing Day budgets can do...

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. Itâ€™s not right that people canâ€™t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Laura's Boxing Day Foodbank Fundraiser

Description:
AFH February Foodbank Fundraiser

As we are still in lockdown, it is not practical for us to setup a food donation station at a local AFH office or arrange a trolley-dash ourselves at the moment. So, we are calling upon the AFH community to donate to our Just Giving page with all proceeds going to the Trussell Trust this February. 

A message from the Trussell Trust:

Our vision is for a UK without the need for food banks.We say this because itâ€™s not right that anyone cannot afford their own food. Thatâ€™s why we are working towards a just, compassionate future, where no one should have to use a food bank to get by.Our vision is ambitious, but we know that if we work together it is possible. We can create a future where nobody goes hungry, because nobody will allow it â€“ when we work Together for Change.#TogetherForChange

Title: Gone bald for Blackpool foodbank!

Description:
Hello lovely people,

During these testing and troubling times I think it's more important than ever to look for the positives and what we can do to make a difference. After much deliberation (I have lovely hair!) I have decided to shave my head on 30/3/2020 for charity.

Having spoken to my local food bank they have informed me that donations of essential items are decreasing already, and only expect this to get worse as the pandemic continues and/if more measures are put in place. Over 500 people a month use this service already, with this only likely to increase due to the economic hardships COVID-19 is likely to bring. 

With the supermarkets already practically empty its not hard to imagine the devastating impact this could have.

Any money raised here will be going directly to Harlow Foodbank (Co-ordinated by the Michael Roberts Charitable Trust) to help with running costs, such as logistics and warehousing costs, as well as purchase of essential items (tinned foods, toiletries, fruit juice etc.) which are already at critically low levels.

With everything that is going on at the moment I understand how difficult it may be to donate. As a self-employed DJ, I myself have no work for the foreseeable future, however even a donation of Â£1 could make a difference. 

Now more than ever its important to look out for people in need.

Thanks for taking the time to read this.

Lash x
Title: SHAVE TO SAVE: FOODBANK FUNDRAISER

Description:
Since our launch in October 2012 Angus foodbank has received donations of 178 tons of food and fed 19,000 people 4,700 being children.  We work with over 100 organisations who refer people to our foodbank, who through various circumstances are unable to afford to buy enough food to keep body and soul together.

Many of the people who come to the foodbank are very embarrassed and and down trodden but it is amazing how often they will return up to a year  later and remind us that they received a food parcel but that having found a new job or help with their situation they now want to make a donation back to the foodbank.

However we still need money to run the foodbank, to pay utility bills, purchase and running costs for our delivery van and other expenses.  We have 1 paid member of staff, our Manager, and 80 volunteers who do a power of work collecting and sorting the donated food and dealing with the people who are in need in a caring and compassionate way.

YOUR HELP IS APPRECIATED

The economic crisis caused by the impact of Covid-19 has continued to drive a sustained surge in the need for food banks. Hundreds of people in the city and surrounding areas have faced immediate cuts to their earned income, closures to their businesses, reduced hours, and complete job losses.

Title: Julie's fundraiser for Foyle Foodbank

Description:
This November, I am running a Marathon in a Month to raise funds for Brandlesholme Foodbank. Many of you may have seen that on Wednesday 21st October parliament voted against extending the Free School Meals (FSM) provision for children during the half-term break. As we are all aware, many families are going through increased financial hardship due to the COVID-19 pandemic. No child should go hungry. 

A message from Brandlesholme Foodbank:

We are pleading with residents, companies and groups. We need as much support as possible and help to raise funds so that we can run and maintain Brandlesholme Foodbank alongside our various forms of support. We aim to keep support withing the community, reducing the strain on the NHS and Bury Council. This support system is in its infancy but we have no choice but to rapidly deploy support. We will face large expenses which we cannot fund ourselves and this is where we are relying on your donations to ensure we can meet demand! This facility of providing food and support packages has been carried out around the UK and internationally, the idea is great and as the beating heart of the community, it is our job to repeat this in Bury, Rammy and Totty. We are a member organisation of the Independent Food Aid Network and work with Fareshare Go by Foodcloud.
Title: Brandlesholme Community Centre & Foodbank

Colleagues in HKA's Glasgow Office recognised that in the current crisis we were in the very fortunate position of being employed, but also saving money while working from home by not commuting and buying lunches, teas and coffees.

Glasgow NE Foodbank are part of a nationwide network of foodbanks, supported by The Trussell Trust, working to combat poverty and hunger across the UK.

Title: Supporting Glasgow NE Foodbank

Description:
Aaron (12) and James (8) chose to join in #maxsbigcampout. They joined in a garden sleepout to celebrate Max's 365th night  under canvas. Max is a boy from Devon who camped out in his garden for a year to raise money for charity. 'I wanted to keep sleeping out because I wanted to raise money for CHAT so everyone could have a fair life' said James. 

CHAT run the local foodbank; provide debt counselling; and housing support. At the moment their use is increasing as more people need their help.

James is planning to continue camping out for a month.

Gail aka Mum decided to set herself a challenge too. She plans to run the distance to Guernsey (100 miles) by the time Guernsey hopes to open it's borders. 'Jogging has been helpful over the lockdowns, but they have been sporadic 5km runs, so now I will have to run more regularly and further. I have chosen the distance to Guernsey as that was where we were due to go on holiday last summer.' she said.

Title: My Donation Page to Foodbank

Description:
Tinned fish is essential for Trussell Trust foodbanks. While many people generously donate tins of beans and cans of soup, there's often a shortage of seafood on their shelves. Canned seafood locks in huge amounts of nutritious goodness and should be in everyone's store cupboard.

To make an enormous difference to many lives, you can donate the cost of a sandwich, takeaway or whatever you can afford. I work for Seafish and know how important fish is for our bodies and health. I'm kicking off the campaign in Seafood Week with the first donation.

We're buying tins of seafood with 90 per cent of all donations. Ten per cent is going to the foodbank charity The Trussell Trust - to support their hard work.

So help us make a difference by donating what you can afford.

Title: LHP Christmas Foodbank Collection

Description:
Everyone has been affected in a way during this pandemic, some more than others. To rebuild and help those most in need we need community, compassion, and generosity. No one should have to go hungry especially the youngest in our society who have faced huge adversity throughout the last 12 months.


In the first six months of the pandemic, the food banks in our network gave out a staggering 1.2 million food parcels. That's one food parcel every 13 seconds, and 2,600 food parcels were given to children every day on average. The impact on young people has been devastating. Together we can build a fairer, more just society, where all of us can afford the essentials. The pandemic has shown the unexpected can hit us suddenly, with devastating consequences for people's lives. But it's also shown we can make huge changes to the way we live and look after each other. It has shown that when we come together we can push for change. Together, we can build a hunger-free future.

By donating a small amount it can make an enormous change in people's lives.
Title: Foodbank donations Trussell Trust

Description:
We are Siobhan and Lisa - also known as French 75 in vintage circles! - and we've pledged to support the Rutland Foodbank throughout 2021, both with donations and awareness.

Until lockdown and Covid-19 restrictions in 2020, we did a personal shop for the foodbank each month, shopping for the items most needed at the time - since lockdown we have switched our shopping to donations via this page instead.  We're grateful to many friends, colleagues and family who also donate to us regularly to boost our fundraising, as well as Intercity Technology, which also supports us with donations.

In April 2020 we started #oakhambookswap - a doorstep book swap box for the community - and money starting popping through the letterbox as a result!  So, if you like what we're doing there and wish to donate having taken some free books you can do so here :-) 

We have a few fundraising ideas for 2021 that we hope will be possible - we'll share more about those as soon as possible.

Â£625 was raised during 2020.

Title: Cambridge UCU Foodbank Fundraiser

Description:
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.

Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: Marguerite Drive's Foodbank Donations

Description:

That's why, this Christmas I'm raising money for the Waterloo Foodbank. I'm helping them reach their target of Â£15,000, to support people this Christmas and throughout the year who need our support. Every penny raised will go directly to the work of the Waterloo Foodbank.

For more information about the work the Foodbank does, please go to oasiswaterloo.org/foodbank

Title: Harvey Family's Foodbank Fundraiser

Description:
We exist to ensure that no one in Waterloo goes hungry.

For people on low incomes, a sudden crisis  redundancy, benefit delay, illness or even an unexpected bill  can mean going hungry. Every day parents skip meals to feed their children and people are forced to choose between paying the rent or eating.

Since our launch weve given away over 100 tonnes of food to over 12,500 people in need, including almost 5,000 local children.

We are part of The Trussell Trusts UK-wide foodbank network, and together we provide food to thousands of people nationwide every year. The Foodbank is hosted at the Oasis Centre, St Johns Waterloo and St George the Martyr on behalf of South Bank Churches.

We work with local frontline care professionals, such as schools, charities, housing associations, GPs, health visitors and churches, to identify those in need. They distribute vouchers that the client then exchanges for food. When clients arrive at the Foodbank, we offer them the chance to meet with
Title: Oasis Hub Waterloo Foodbank
