Here at Carpenters, as part of our corporate social responsibility activity, we have been working with our staff to introduce food collection points in all six of our offices across the UK, including three of our offices based in Merseyside.

Once the donations have come in, we then distribute foodbank items to fans Supporting Foodbanks, a joint initiative between Everton (Est. 1878) and Liverpool (Spirit of Shankly) fan clubs and the Charles Thompson Mission in Birkenhead, just two of the wonderful volunteer organisations in the region who are working hard to supply basic provisions to those in need.

Since we started the initiative in September 2017, we have seen many people want to help but are unsure how so we have set up this page for those who wish to donate but we will also include any donations we might receive.

Please join the fight against hunger and food waste and support FareShare today. 

Thank you

Description:
This Spring, the Re:Member team are inviting all CGI Glasgow members to support the Trussell Trust's Glasgow South West foodbank, to help them continue the amazing work they do in our local communities. 

In the first six months of the pandemic, food banks in the Trussell Trust network gave out a staggering 1.2 million emergency food parcels. Thatâ€™s one food parcel every 13 seconds, and 2,600 of these went to children every day on average.

Over a year later, things are still very difficult for a lot of members of our communities, and foodbanks have been a lifeline for a lot of people during these difficult times.

Title: RigNet Aberdeen Foodbank Fundraising Appeal

Description:
The outbreak of the Coronavirus has quite literally changed everyone's lives and turned society upside down. However, The Salvation Army in Street is resolute and strong and we will carry on, doing what we can to support people and communities in the ways that we can, within the Government guidelines.

In true Salvation Army Spirit, our greatest strength is our flexible, responsive local presence. Right now, each of our 650 corps and community centres will know exactly what the most effective things are to do. Here in Street we have been working alongside the Street community support group to provide emergency food support to those who need it the most.

With the continued restrictions upon movement in the community we realise that it may be hard for people to get out and buy food items to be donated. So if this is the case for you, and you would like to support this vital work then please use this page to show your support.

Your donations will go directly to providing food people in our community in Street.

Thank you for your support. God Bless from the Salvation Army in Street.
Title: Street Salvation Army foodbank donations

Description:
A plea for support

At Keighley Salvation Army we work with several individuals and families in need of help with food and toiletries. The food bank has been running for over 20 years and on an average week we would hand out around 30 â€“ 35 parcels. We also support several Asylum seekers and refugees each week with
food, clothing such as school uniforms and travel costs.

However, since the start of the pandemic in 2020 the need for food parcels has grown. Working alongside other food banks and support agencies working in Keighley and the surrounding area well over 2,500 parcels have been delivered or given out. This increase is due to illness, job loss, people isolating, changes to benefits and many other valid reasons why people are struggling and need of support.

As always, our supporters have been very generous with donations of food and money to keep our food bank stocked but we are now beginning to run low on many items.

If you can help us by donating, we would be extremely grateful.

Thank you.

Title: Keighley Salvation Army Foodbank Fund

Description:
East Bristol Foodbank provides emergency food parcels, budgeting advice and debt support to people living in poverty.

There often seems there is not much we can do when our Government votes to not feed hungry kids. We can however help local organisations to continue to do the incredible work they do.

I'm raising money for East Bristol Foodbank and your contribution will make an impact, whether you donate Â£1 or Â£100. Every little bit helps. I've included information about East Bristol Foodbank below.

Every day people in the UK go hungry for reasons ranging from redundancy to receiving an unexpected bill on a low income. Trussell Trust foodbanks provide a minimum of three days emergency food and support to people experiencing crisis in the UK.

All food is donated by the public and sorted by volunteers. Frontline care professionals such as doctors and social workers identify people in crisis and issue a food voucher. Clients receive three days of nutritionally balanced, non-perishable food in exchange for their food voucher. Foodbanks also make time to chat and to signpost clients to other helpful services.

Hunger is not just a third world problem. Today people across the UK will struggle to feed themselves and their families. Redundancy, illness, benefit delay, domestic violence, debt, family breakdown and paying for heating during winter are just some of the reasons why people go hungry.
Title: East Bristol Xmas Foodbank Appeal

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Description:
We exist to ensure that no one in Waterloo goes hungry.

For people on low incomes, a sudden crisis  redundancy, benefit delay, illness or even an unexpected bill  can mean going hungry. Every day parents skip meals to feed their children and people are forced to choose between paying the rent or eating.

Since our launch weve given away over 100 tonnes of food to over 12,500 people in need, including almost 5,000 local children.

We are part of The Trussell Trusts UK-wide foodbank network, and together we provide food to thousands of people nationwide every year. The Foodbank is hosted at the Oasis Centre, St Johns Waterloo and St George the Martyr on behalf of South Bank Churches.

We work with local frontline care professionals, such as schools, charities, housing associations, GPs, health visitors and churches, to identify those in need. They distribute vouchers that the client then exchanges for food. When clients arrive at the Foodbank, we offer them the chance to meet with
Title: Nick Ostrowski donating to Waterloo Foodbank

Description:
Harvest is a time of year when we come together and celebrate abundance of food by sharing with one another. This year Harvest looks quite different to previous years but the heart behind sharing and giving to one another still stays true.

Since April and all through the lockdown, the Southwark Foodbank has been delivering food parcels instead of people collecting them from centres and more than ever are relying on the public's support to keep the services running for even more people. In April alone, foodbank usage went up by 400% in Southwark.

To keep supporters safe, the foodbank is encouraging donations of Funds For Food, instead of physical food donations. 

Help us support the Southwark Foodbank with a small donation to keep them going strong as we head into Autumn and celebrate Harvest, giving to those in our community who might be struggling to afford food even more than normal because of COVID-19.

Thank you for supporting!

Title: Nicole's RHONDDA foodbank appeal for christmas

Description:
Every day people in the UK go hungry for reasons ranging from redundancy to receiving an unexpected bill on a low income. A simple box of food makes a big difference, with foodbanks helping prevent crime, housing loss, family breakdown and mental health problems.

We shouldn't need foodbanks in Britain, but we do and so I'm keen to help the Trussell Trust as part of my Booze-free appeal.  People shouldn't be in a position where they can't feed themselves or their children.  Your donations can make a difference to the Trussell Trust's hugely important work.

Did you know?

The Trussell Trust runs a network of over 400 foodbanks, giving emergency food and support to people in crisis across the UK, where thirteen million people live below the poverty line. In the last year they gave 1,182,954 three day emergency food supplies to people in crisis.

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our page. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

The Improvement Team within East Lothian Council have decided to hike the East Lothian section of John Muir Way, 60km (37 miles) within 12 hours. Starting at 7:00am at Musselburgh Harbour and finishing at the Dunbear Sculpture in Dunbar by 7:00pm. Between the team we aim to walk 450km (278 miles). We are aiming to use this challenge to raise funds for the councils charity of the year - East Lothian Foodbank. 

East Lothian Foodbank was set up in 2012 as a direct response to local need.  The local MP and church ministers were being appealed to by people who literally had no-one else to turn to.  It became apparent very quickly that this need was not going to be a temporary one and that there was a growing number of people experiencing severe food poverty.

Since opening their doors theyâ€™ve given out 16,593 food parcels containing 244,105 kg of donations and feeding 22,588
adults and 13,179 children. Thatâ€™s over 326,750 meals! 

In addition theyâ€™ve distributed 84,425 kg to other community projects including their Christmas jingle bags and holiday lunch clubs.

Compassion, care & dignity are at the heart of everything they do and we know theyâ€™ll always be there for anyone who needs their support, whilst working towards a future where emergency food isnâ€™t needed at all.

They do all this with a volunteer Trustee board, a small staff team, a huge team of volunteers and a vast number of community supporters.

Description:
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.

Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Title: DL Foodbank Fundraiser Pub Quiz

Description:
Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. Itâ€™s not right that people canâ€™t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

In the words of our founder Max.....

"This group was never about trade in the economic sense. It was always about humanity and it was always about love. And it was also about understanding that music is an *essential* element of our being human. We have every reason to think that communities have been singing, playing, drumming and dancing together for hundreds of thousands of years, with every song and beat binding people together, literally creating and perpetuating harmony across our planet.

In our modern world, and contrary to all our instincts, we have commodified our artistic output and although we have created great art, high and low, in the process, we have also forgotten that music belongs to us all. If you have ever felt like expressing yourself artistically but stopped because you felt that your art was not worthy, the Viral Jukebox is your home. I mean it.

More than once since I created this group people have suggested that I could find a way to monetise it. They are missing the point. The currency here is love. Spend freely. Give freely. And remember, if you sang or played it from your heart, you played it right."

So this Christmas, with the Pandemic rolling on and weird hybrid lockdown in place, we thought it would be great to raise money, together, for our favourite causes, so choose the one closest to your heart (or follow the person who made a song you like and vote for a cause they love!)

Happy Christmas Jukeboxers!

Title: Harmonix Kent and Partners Christmas 2018 charitable support

Description:
The last few months have seen immense suffering and hardship from storms and flooding. However the outbreak of the Coronavirus has quite literally changed everyones lives and turned society upside down.
However, The Salvation Army is resolute and strong and just as we did in the Spanish Flu pandemic, and during the bombing and the Blitz we will carry on, doing what we can to support people and communities  in the ways that we can, within the Government guidelines.
In true Salvation Army Spirit, our greatest strength is our flexible, responsive local presence. Right now, each of our 650 corps and community centres will know exactly what the most effective things are to do. We are not just responding to the virus impact in one or two ways, but dozens and dozens of different ways, from food banks to counselling, from supporting NHS isolation units to checking up on people who are living alone
Please give what you can to enable us to help as many people as possible!

Title: Heartspace's Horsham Foodbank Charity Yoga Class

Description:
Bearsden West Community Council is proposing that we as a Community set up a foodbank collection point in the local area to serve the Glasgow NW foodbank. Studies have shown that people are more likely to donate food if donation points are local. Currently, there is no collection point in Westerton.

With the introduction of Universal credit to Glasgow by December 2018 resources at centers are becoming stretched. Last year in NW Glasgow alone nearly 9000 people used the foodbank, over 4x the population of Westerton. This is unacceptable in the society we live in.  

Therefore we are asking, especially in the run-up to Christmas, for donations of the following items:

[CLICK HERE FOR SHOPPING LIST] 

For those who would not be able to make food donations we will also be collecting funds which can be donated securely online on this page. 
I hope we as a community can make this a regular thing and we can make this Christmas drive the start of something bigger.

If you have any questions you can contact us at: bwcc@westertonvillage.org.uk or the food bank directly at: info@glasgowNW.foodbank.org.uk


Thanks a million for your support!
Title: Bearsden West Community Council Foodbank Appeal

Description:
We exist to ensure that no one in Waterloo goes hungry.

For people on low incomes, a sudden crisis  redundancy, benefit delay, illness or even an unexpected bill  can mean going hungry. Every day parents skip meals to feed their children and people are forced to choose between paying the rent or eating.

Since our launch weve given away over 100 tonnes of food to over 12,500 people in need, including almost 5,000 local children.

We are part of The Trussell Trusts UK-wide foodbank network, and together we provide food to thousands of people nationwide every year. The Foodbank is hosted at the Oasis Centre, St Johns Waterloo and St George the Martyr on behalf of South Bank Churches.

We work with local frontline care professionals, such as schools, charities, housing associations, GPs, health visitors and churches, to identify those in need. They distribute vouchers that the client then exchanges for food. When clients arrive at the Foodbank, we offer them the chance to meet with
Title: Oasis Waterloo Foodbank - Covid19 Relief Fund

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

We usually collect for our local foodbank and make a delivery to them several times a month. While we are all working remotely we would like to continue to support them where we can by raising money for supplies.

We appreciate all donations.
Title: Arkessa are raising money for Bishops Stortford Foodbank

Description:
From now until Pancake Day (16 Feb) I am raising money for the Lewisham Foodbank via recipe sharing. 

Each day I will be sharing a recipe on the instagram page #leftoversrecipeshare which is good for using up leftovers  (and feel free to comment with any of your recipes too - the more the better!).  

If you see a recipe on the insta page that you like then please make a donation here in return.  The Lewisham Foodbank has never been busier and winter is an especially challenging time.  Any and all donations are very gratefully received.  

If you would like to learn more about the Lewisham Foodbank then do visit https://lewisham.foodbank.org.uk.  You can find out more about how to donate food or volunteer there too.

I hope you enjoy a new dish, and thank you so much for all your support.

Candy
Title: Leftovers Recipe Share Fundraiser for Lewisham Foodbank

Description:
We are the Preston Pantomime Group and today would normally have been our final dress rehearsal for our annual February half term panto. For the first time in 42 years the costumes and scenery remain silent and untouched in the cupboards! Sadly another casualty of COVID.

We have all missed each otherâ€™s company and all the last minute panic that the show brings. Of course we are really sad not to have been able to entertain you but also that we have not been able to support local charities as we usually do with our audiences help.

So, this is where we are asking for help from our lovely past audiences. Pretend you are still coming to watch but instead of paying for your ticket or your draw tickets or even your interval coffee  or ice cream make a donation to support our chosen charity, The Weymouth Foodbank.

Please help us to make a difference.

We would love your support to donate to this worthy cause. Every donation will make a difference.

Thank you in advance for your contribution to this cause that means so much to us and the community. Now, more than ever, would your donation make a difference to local families.

Thank you
Title: Preston Pantomime Group supporting Weymouth Foodbank

Title: Private Sector Finance supports Waterloo Foodbank

Description:
As the UK comes to terms with the Coronavirus outbreak what happens to the less fortunate? Over 14 million people in the UK already live in poverty and parts of Greater Manchester have some of the highest child poverty rates in the country. Many thousands of people in our communities already struggle to put food on the table.

Manchester Central Foodbank serve some of the most in need areas in Manchester such as Longsight, Ardwick and East Manchester and are already seeing increased demand due to Coronavirus. Those in insecure work and those already struggling to make ends meet may increasingly need somewhere to turn.

At the same time with localised shortages of some necessities there have been reports of drops in donations to foodbanks. Foodbanks need to replenish supplies themselves with cash donations.

If you feel like you want to do something to help the community during this worrying time please consider donating to Manchester Central Foodbank. Â£10 could provide a person with food for 3 days.

The foodbank is run by volunteers and all the money raised will go to buy food for those most in need. They intend to remain open to serve the community at this testing time. Lets help them with some donations so they can meet increasing demand.
Title: Manchester for Europe Covid-19 Foodbank Appeal

Description:
When I saw Jeremy Huntâ€™s tweet thanking Rishi Sunak for donating Â£50 towards the cost of his Â£106 lunch I was speechless. He is already worth Â£12m yet still pocketed the money. It made me both sad and mad in equal measures, but I hope that if folks do get to eat out and receive Â£10 off their bill, they are able to donate some or all of the saving to the Trussell Trust. At least some good could come of this initiative and be redirected to those that need it most. 

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. Itâ€™s not right that people canâ€™t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

In the UK and Republic of Ireland this work includes more than 800 Salvation Army social service centres and community churches. We provide unconditional friendship, support and very practical help to people in crisis and need and work with children, homeless people, all adult victims of modern slavery and those dealing with drug and/or alcohol addiction.

Our vision is for a UK without the need for food banks. We say this because itâ€™s not right that anyone cannot afford their own food. Title: Believe and Do Good 2021 - Foodbank Donations

Description:
Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children.

With the current coronavirus crisis, many vulnerable people are out of work and thus out of food. It's an incredibly challenging time in particular for at-risk communities who rely on the services of foodbanks - and those numbers are set to dramatically increase. Your support will be greatly appreciated.

The Trussell Trust supports a nationwide network of food banks and together we provide emergency food and support to people locked in poverty, and campaign for change to end the need for food banks in the UK.

They are also greatly in need of volunteers at this time, so if you are healthy and able to spare some time, please sign up at: https://www.trusselltrust.org/get-involved/volunteer/
Title: Diana's Supporting UK Foodbanks through Covid-19

Description:

We support people on low income, those who have lost their jobs, those who have no recourse to public funds and many more.

We want to make sure everyone is able to have a meal and be able to maintain their dignity. We recognise that food is not the only essential items that individuals need so we provide where possible toiletries, nappies, feminine hygiene products and some household cleaning products.

Description:
The Trussell Trust supports a network of 1200 food banks providing emergency food and support for than 14 million people living in poverty â€“ including 4.5 million children. There are Trussell Trust centres near the University of Birmingham at Quinton and Cotteridge. In the last year the network provided a record 1.9 million food parcels.

Care professionals such as health visitors, teachers and social workers identify people in crisis and issue them with a food bank voucher. This means people can receive a food bank parcel of three daysâ€™ nutritionally balanced, non-perishable food from their local food bank.

If you feel generous and can afford to you can also set up a standing order for regular donations to our local foodbank in Quinton.

https://quintonoldbury.foodbank.org.uk/contact-us/

During lockdown Conny and I decided to donate monthly just what we saved on buying coffee each day to the Quinton foodbank and it came to a surprising amount that we could afford to give to a good cause.
Title: Let's donate the cost of Christmas dinner to Trussell Trust foodbanks

Description:
ï»¿The Global Foodbanking Network helps save food waste by donating surplus food to people across the globe that need it the most. Due to a loss of jobs as a result of the COVID-19 outbreak, more people are using food banks. To meet this increased demand, the Network is partnering with local food banks across the world to feed disadvantaged people in over 43 countries.

How can you help?

Here at MUFG, we are holding an EMEA wide Workstation Photo Competition to support charities like the Global Foodbanking Network who are helping the most vulnerable at this time. To join the competition you will need to:

1. Take a photo of your work space.

2. Make a minimum donation of Â£10 (or the equivalent) to the Global Foodbanking Network.

3. Submit your photo to your local CSR champion.

Your generous donation will support the Global Foodbanking Network will help feed those most in need during these unprecedented times.

ï»¿For more information please visit www.foodbanking.org


ï»¿Thank you for all your support!

Title: Fundraising for the local community

Description:
Save the Mothers Trust (SMT) jointly with Bradford Central Lions Club launched its Food Bank in March 2014 to provide food and support to those less fortunate and in need. The Food Bank is located at the SMT head office in Bradford, West Yorkshire. Since the launch of the Food Bank, it has served many individuals as well as families with young children who are suffering extreme hardships due to cut backs in the benefit system. Some of these people have not eaten for several days and have struggled due to the lack of basic amenities such as heating and electricity. We continuously require items to place in food parcels or cash donations to purchase them. We would appreciate your co-operation in achieving our goal to serve the needy, thereby gaining reward from Allah (SWT).
Donate from as little as Â£5 per month or Â£30 to provide one food parcel
Title: SMT Food Bank (UK)

CharityName: Food Bank For New York City
Description: Natilik are dedicating the next few months to raise money for Food Bank for New York City. During this difficult time the Food bank is taking important steps to ensure that vulnerable New Yorkers who may be quarantined, along with those impacted by the economic downturn, are being supported and provided with emergency food
Title: Natilik's Food Bank for NYC Support

Description:
2020 has been a very tumultuous year to say the least with so many things happening in the UK and abroad during the pandemic in March, I chose to help setup a Soup Kitchen in Finsbury Park because I could relate not only to the problems many were facing, but I had first hand experience with falling on hard times with a large portion of my youth spent being homeless for 7 years.

I feel like this is my way of giving back, I am not in a unique position to know what these problems feel like on a personal level, but to have also come out of it, but I couldn't have done it on my own, and often times I just needed a little bit of support to get to the next day, so this is the same thing I would like to do, help 1000 people get to tomorrow... 

Will you you join me in this pledge?
Title: Dami's Food Bank & Soup Kitchen

Title: In memory of Sally

Description:
The current Coronavirus pandemic is having a huge economic and social impact right across the country. For many that means turning to foodbanks to support them in getting the vital supplies they need.

Dudley College provides outstanding education to thousands of young people and adults across the Black Country and is committed to supporting the community through education. While we educate our students from distance, we also want to be able to support our community practically. We have been supporting our community through collecting food for the foodbank for a number of years and now turn to asking for your donations.

The Black Country foodbanks support people in crisis across the Black Country and are able to provide food, but needs funding to be able to do so because donations of food have reduced during lockdown.

FE Foodbank Friday has been developed for Colleges across the country to raise funds for their local foodbanks, through this crisis and beyond.

Can you spare the cost of your morning coffee for our appeal? Please donate what you can during this crisis to help support our community.

Description:
Novus Property Solutions is pledging to donate Â£1,000 to a Stoke-on-Trent food bank as part of its 21 in 2021 campaign. The campaign aims to get 21 local businesses to make the pledge to keep effectively supporting struggling people throughout 2021 and beyond.

Novus is shocked to learn that the enormous cost of operating a food bank works out to approximately Â£140,000 per year! It is because of this, we wanted to do our part to help keep this fantastic service running. 

Today, the Stoke-on-Trent food bank feeds 14,000 people per year, making it a vital service in the community.

All Novus employees, clients and suppliers have been encouraged to get involved and support this great cause.

Description:
I have gone slightly mad and will be running the Bristol 10k!  If you know even a few minimal facts about me you will know this is a BIG DEAL.  So may people in the UK are struggling, and no-one should have to go without food and basic necessities.  So managing to get my bum in gear and run for a bit is worth it if it can help some of those people. 

Over the last five years, the number of emergency food parcels
provided to people in crisis by food banks in the Trussell Trustâ€™s
network has increased by 73%. Last year alone, food banks in our
network distributed over 1.6 million food parcels, with over half a
million of these going to children.

This is not right.

Our vision is for a UK without the need for food banks. We say this because itâ€™s not right that anyone cannot afford their own food. Thatâ€™s why we are working towards a just, compassionate future, where no one should have to use a food bank to get by. Our vision is ambitious, but we know that if we work together it is possible. We can create a future where nobody goes hungry, because nobody will allow it â€“ when we work Together for Change .#TogetherForChange
Title: Charlotte can run!  For the Trussell Trust Foodbank charity

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

The LUFC Supporters' Trust, through its 'Leeds Fans Food Bank' initiative, supports the Leeds South and East Food Bank and the Leeds North and West Foodbank.  We shouldn't need food banks in 2020, but we do, more than ever. I'm 55 and about 3 stone overweight. I shouldn't need to do 'Couch to 5k' in 2020, but I do, more than ever.

I've been doing this 9 week 'running' challenge and trying to raise funds for this important cause at the same time. It might put some meals on the tables of some people who really need them, and it might help change a few lazy perceptions of football fans and what they care about. It might lower my blood pressure and my cholesterol levels too.

It's actually 11 weeks (icy roads, work and a few aches and pains spread it out) but today I completed the last run of 5k. Going out in some grim weather at times has been made easier knowing kind people are donating to this good cause. This would have been easier in summer...

People supporting this small challenge have donated Â£575 to support the Leeds Fans Foodbank - I'm very grateful to everyone who contributed. I'll stop seeking further donations in the next day or so.

Thanks to @riotbadger for confirming this was a half-decent idea and to @lufctrust for encouraging me when I asked if it would be possible.
Title: Chris's Couch to 5K for Leeds South and East Foodbank (@LeedsFansFoodbank)

Description:
As part of the â€˜Get Moving MNF Risk Team Challengeâ€™, the team have joined together in a challenge for two very worthy charities, whilst kicking the January 2021 blues and getting fit by setting a step challenge.

The challenge will start on the 18th January and finish on the 20th March (60 days) and each walk or runâ€™s steps will count towards a team-wide goal of â€˜walkingâ€™ 9727 miles (as the crow flies) from Cardiff to Cape Town.

Cardiff Foodbank charity was voted for by MNF Risk colleagues,  particularly colleagues who felt passionately about the work Cardiff Foodbank carries out within our local community. 

â€˜Foodbanks are already the last resort for an increasing number of people in UK experiencing desperate financial hardship. This latest health crisis is pushing the most at risk and vulnerable further into the grip of poverty. Food aid charities have also identified the emergence of the UKâ€™s â€œnewly hungryâ€, a growing cohort of people previously in good jobs and enjoying comfortable incomes who have been forced to use food banks and claim welfare benefits for the first time during the pandemic.â€™

Thank you in advance for any donation, large or small, that will go towards supporting this
charity. 

Every donation you give will help to feed families and individuals going hungry across Cardiff.

MNF Risk Team
Title: MNF's Get Moving Risk Team Challenge - Cardiff Foodbank

Description:
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.

Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: clare's South Essex College supporting FE Foodbank Friday

Description:
During the pandemic I have been finding ways to support and help others using my love of sewing. Initially I made uniform bags and scrubs for my NHS colleagues to keep them safe and then somebody asked me if I could make some face coverings for them to buy. I was happy to make them free of charge, but asked for a donation to a food bank so that others in need could benefit instead. 

Since then I have had numerous requests to make more face coverings and the requests are coming think and fast now that the Government have said that face coverings will be mandatory from 24th July. 

I will be making more over the coming days and will post pictures of the ones available. Due to current demand I am no longer able to make bespoke designs. What you see is what you get - .hope you understand!  If you see one that you would like then please let me know,  make a donation to this page. and I will then make arrangements for get it to you.

Please note  - the face coverings are made from 2 layers of fabric and are not therefore a â€˜medical gradeâ€™ mask. They are designed to limit the spread of droplets that may transmit COVID 19 and there is no guarantee that they will prevent you from catching the virus from others. They should be washed daily at 60 degrees.  Social distancing and hand washing should still be carried out as per public health guidelines as these are the best methods to prevent infection currently available.

Title: Help us raise money to feed the disadvantaged!

Description:
Every year at Christmas, The Salvation Army in Openshaw provides toys and gifts for families who struggling financially. We recognise that has been a very difficult year for so many people. 

We provide for a number of local families. Much of this is only possible because of the overwhelming generosity of the general public.  Each year we receive donations of toys, food and money and we are  extremely grateful.

Any gift, however small or large will be very much appreciated. Thank you.

The Salvation Army is a Christian Church & registered Charity working in 130 countries worldwide and is one of the largest and most diverse providers of social welfare in the world. In the UK and Republic of Ireland this work includes more than 800 Salvation Army social service centres and community churches. We provide unconditional friendship, support and very practical help to people in crisis and need and work with children, homeless people, all adult victims of modern slavery and those dealing with drug and/or alcohol addiction.
Title: Openshaw Salvation Army Toy Appeal

Description:
Hi everyone ðŸ‘‹

I'm doing my first 7-Day extended fast from Friday 26th March.

I've decided to try and raise money for a food bank in Belfast, they are an amazing group and help people so much, even more so now with the struggles of living in these times.

I'll post up how I prepare for a fast and I'll also keep you updated at the end of each day, showing the benefits and different stages of fasting (in case anyone is interested ðŸ˜Š).

If I don't make it the full 7 days I'll donate Â£20 for each day although I'm sure this won't be necessary.

If you wish to sponsor me or donate anything at all that would be amazing, even something small is greatly appreciated!

Can my friends and family please share this post for me.

Thanks :D

*Edit* A few people are concerned so just wanted to explain that what I'm doing isn't dangerous if done correctly. I've practiced this for nearly 6 months now, I'm also fat adapted so I burn fat instead of glucose for fuel. Fat lasts much much longer and gives the body what it needs when you can't eat. This is similar to the ancestral human diet and is what would've happened if they were unable to hunt anything for days. After a certain period of fasting your body enters into autophagy, where your cells recycle and rejuvenate and get rid of any bad cells. This is normally the aim for someone doing an extended fast and it's amazing. So please don't be concerned, I know what I'm doing and there'll be no harm done :)
Title: Jack's 7 Day fast for South-West Belfast foodbank

Description:
Dear all,

In 2008 when I started working for the RDS I had no idea that I would stay for this long. Two kids and PhD later, I have quite literally grown up with this job!

As some of you know, we are emigrating to Kuala Lumpur at the end of July. 

So, here we are, nearly 12 years on, and almost the last 17 weeks have been in lockdown! Itâ€™s fair to say there will be no party. I feel sad that I wonâ€™t get a chance to say a proper goodbye to so many of you. Under any â€˜normalâ€™ circumstances, I would be planning an epic party to mark my leaving from the RDS EM but this is not going to be possible and the thought of a Locktini on Zoom fills me with cringing awkwardness ïŠ

So, I would like to ask for your help instead so hereâ€™s my storyâ€¦

Since lockdown one thing that has helped me to retain my sanity and happiness (whilst home schooling a 4 and 7 year old and working) is cooking and eating with my family. I believe that food influences our moods, our physical recovery and brings a focus to the day.

But whilst I have been enjoying delicious homemade food, I have also been reflecting on how privileged I am to buy the ingredients I need and have heating facilities to cook food with. My eyes have been opened even more since I started volunteering in March at a local foodbank in Leicester. I help, with other volunteers, to make food and sanitation parcels.

So many families have been struck further into food poverty since COVID-19. 

This foodbank like many others relies solely on donations from Fareshare, the goodwill of community leaders and local people, so that local families donâ€™t go hungry. 

Itâ€™s been thoroughly enjoyable and inspiring working with you all. Iâ€™ve learned so much and leave with very happy memories. My last working day is the 8th July. 

Please keep in touch, add me to your LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/in/raksha-pandya-wood-79204733 or just drop me an email: rpandyawood@gmail.com

Take care and stay safe

Raksha Pandya-Wood

Description:
ï»¿ï»¿ï»¿ï»¿ï»¿The Coronavirus is already having a hugely negative economic and social impact across the UK, and preventing many vulnerable people from buying the basic items they need.

Glasgow Clyde College wants to engage with our community to help raise awareness and funds to support people through these trying times.

We are working hard to ensure we have a real, positive impact on the lives of our communities.  We have the resources and the fantastic staff and students to make it happen.

That is why we are joining the FE colleges nationally in the FE Foodbank Friday Initiative.  Since the programme started on 20 March, many colleges across the UK are pledging to take part.

As staff and students are now working and studying remotely, it is becoming difficult for staff and students to physically donate items.  That is why we are joining this fundraising campaign, which aims to raise Â£1,500 so that Glasgow food banks can continue to operate despite social distancing taking place.

We are asking for donations during this very difficult time to ensure we come through the crisis together.  All donations will be shared equally across all four Glasgow Food banks - North East, North West, South East and South West.

Thank-you for your donation.
Title: Glasgow Clyde College supporting FE Foodbank Friday Initiative

Description:
Manchester University Geographical Society (MUGS) aims to bring together all undergraduates, postgraduates and staff in the Geographical community to both socialise and broaden our geographical knowledge. Geography sits within the School of Environment, Education and Development (SEED). 

SEED is one of four schools within the Faculty of Humanities at the University of Manchester. SEEDâ€™s core aim is to understand and improve the uneven relationships between society, economy and the environment.

Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, MUGS and SEED have combined our fundraising efforts and are dedicating our time to helping out communities in Manchester which have been hit by the pandemic. Please either donate monetarily or through food and other items in the Chaplaincy on Oxford Road (in between the Church and KroBar)
Title: COVID-19 Fundraiser by MUGS and SEED

Description:
My name is Emily Beaumont, I am 7 years old and I live in High Lane, Stockport. I love walking with my mum and sister so I decided over Christmas that I want to walk 100 miles in February 2021 to raise money to help others. I have done my walking plan already (see the gallery page). I like helping others and I have raised money for charity before and helped homeless charities with my mum but this idea is my own idea and my biggest challenge yet! My mum will help and walk with me in February. I will post pictures every day and will give you an update from my walks. Please sponsor me so I can help others and support my local foodbank, Stockport Foodbank. Thank you! Emily Beaumont xxx 

Stockport Foodbank operates from six centres across Stockport, providing food to people in crisis.
Title: Emily (aged 7) is walking 100 Miles in Feb 2021 for Stockport Foodbank

Description:
Thank you to everyone who has donated to this campaign, without the support of so many of you we would not have been able to continue, launch new sites and ultimately address the immediate food crisis caused by coronavirus.

As the coronavirus crisis has continued, we have experienced a huge increase in need. To illustrate this, prior to the crisis our busiest week was in December 2019, where we supported 117 individuals and families across four foodbanks.  In the last week of April 2020, just one of our seven foodbanks supported 126 individuals and families. This increase in need means our weekly food bill would be almost Â£8,000, should we need to purchase it, not to mention staffing, transport and equipment.  

Sadly, we are expecting this increased need to continue for the foreseeable future as more people experience difficulty as a result of coronavirus and its wider consequences.  We still donâ€™t think anyone in our community should have to face going hungry. Thatâ€™s why we asking you to support us to continue to provide three daysâ€™ nutritionally balanced emergency food to local people, in the initial crisis, through 2020 and beyond!

Sometimes the numbers involved can seem daunting so weâ€™ll make it simple - Â£27 provides food and basic essentials for a family of three.

Thank so much for all your support, love and encouragement â€“ S6 foodbank!
Title: Hallam CC Food Bank Appeal

Description:
The Coronavirus is already having a hugely negative economic and social impact across the UK, whether thatâ€™s job uncertainty or self-isolation preventing many vulnerable people from buying the basic items they need.

As an education provider Loughborough College wants to engage with our community to help raise awareness and funds to help people through these trying times.

We are working hard to ensure we have a real, positive impact on the lives of our local communities. We have the resources and the fantastic staff to help make it happen.

That is why we are joining FE colleges nationally in the FE Food Bank Friday initiative. Since the programme started on Friday 20 March many colleges across the country are pledging to take part.

As staff and students are now working and studying remotely, it is becoming difficult for staff and students to physically donate any items. That is why we have joined this fundraising campaign, which aims to raise Â£2,000 so that foodbanks can continue to operate despite social distancing taking place across the country.

We are asking anyone willing during this extremely tough period to consider donating what they can to ensure that we all can pull through this crisis together.

Thank you so much for your kind donation.


About The Trussell Trust

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. Itâ€™s not right that people canâ€™t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

Title: Ford UK Purchasing Event - Autumn Harvest Foodbank Collection 2016

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

We recently attended and Anti Poverty evening in Kirkcaldy and I was shocked to find out that Kirkcaldy foodbank alone spend Â£8000 per month on food! Run by 100 volunteers. More than one third of those who receive support from Kirkcaldy foodbank are children. 8650 food parcels per month are given out from Kirkcaldy foodbank. These figures left me feeling very sad and that I wanted to do something to help.

I know many of us have our kitchen cupboards packed so full that if we simply cleared away the tins of soup we aren't going to use, the pasta packets that we have 4 of along with the excess boxes of cereal we have never looked at. That we together could help these people and help Kirkcaldy foodbank, even if its a drop in the ocean for them.

That is why I am asking you all to please donate Â£5 worth of food from your cupboards, or Â£5 from your purse/ wallet.

In return, your name will be entered into our draw to win a kitchen deep clean inc oven clean to the value of Â£80. Once the draw ends I will pull one name from a hat and that lucky winner will receive this offer. You can enter as many times as you like. So go on, have that kitchen clear out and see just how much you have that can be donated, I bet its a lot more than you think!!!

Thank you in advance,

Cara and all the team at Domestic Matters x
Title: Domestic Matters Kitchen deep clean give away

Description:
At this time of year, colleagues at AkzoNobel in Gateshead, along with their family and friends, usually collect Easter Eggs on behalf of the food bank to be handed out to families across the region. In recent years, people have generously donated hundreds of eggs to children that may go without.

With us all still being locked down to some extent, I thought it was a good idea to allow people to donate direct to the food bank to allow them to buy eggs on your behalf or stock up on much needed essentials to keep the operation going. Over Christmas, people raised almost Â£700 for families in the region. Thank you! If you can help again, it would be much appreciated.

Title: Easter Appeal for Gateshead Food Bank

Description:
At this time of year, the people (and their family and friends) at AkzoNobel in Gateshead usually collect advent calendars and deliver to the Foodbank to distribute to families with children. 

This year, due to the restrictions that COVID-19 brings in terms of not being able to meet to collect calendars, I thought I would encourage you to donate to the foodbank direct to help them at a time when demand has increased significantly. In 2019, the Gateshead Foodbank provided 87 tonnes of goods to families in the area that needed it. By October 2020, they had already exceeded that total and delivered 97 tonnes.

Just Â£1 can allow the amazing volunteers at the Foodbank to provide an advent calendar for one child. They will also use any donations to help put together hampers so that families who struggle to make ends meet can still put food on the table during the festive season.

Anything you can spare would be amazing and will go a long way to ensuring that those in need get a bit of help towards the end of 2020.

Title: Stuart's Dry January

Description:
Thank you for supporting S6 Foodbank. Every donation made goes directly to support their work.

Without the assistance of people and businesses in Sheffield, S6 Foodbank wouldnt be able to continue to support their guests, launch new sites and tackle the ongoing food crisis in Sheffield which is being exacerbated by coronavirus.

S6 Foodbank are expecting the increased need to continue for the foreseeable future, as more people experience difficulty as a result of coronavirus and its wider consequences. I believe that nobody in Sheffield should have to face going hungry. 

A donation of Â£27 provides food and basic essentials for a family of three for three days. I am aiming to raise at least Â£40 to help S6 Foodbank reach their Â£40,000 target. Whatever I raise (up to that target) will be match-funded by the Government via the Love Your Neighbour partnership, meaning S6 Foodbank receives double the amount.

Thank you for sponsoring me, and a huge thank you too from Chris and the team

Description:
The staff of Renfrewshire Council, Scotland Excel and the Care Inspectorate are working in partnership with Food Bank Food Rush Initiative to help support our partner Renfrewshire Food Bank during this busy time presently and as we go into the summer period.   

This year is just like last year where we wont be able to hold our office food collection, but will participate through an online collection.  The page will be available between Monday 7th June 2021 - Friday 9th July 2021.  The donations will help Renfrewshire Food Bank buy the items they are low on and are in desperate need off.  It will also assist in forward planning in the weeks ahead. 

It is what we do together that will have the biggest and most effective impact.  Let's come together, from further apart, fundraising to help those who need it most in our communities in their time of need.

Description:
We are fortunate that the majority of our TalkTalk colleagues are provided with the tools, flexibility and support to be able to work from home during this crisis.

Foodbanks will be supporting many families and individuals through the coming weeks and possibly months. 

This will undoubtedly put a further strain on these services. There is less footfall in supermarkets, resulting in fewer donations at foodbank collection points. Many children rely upon school meals to obtain their primary nourishment. The school closures will result in more people approaching foodbanks for assistance.

If you can support this service by donating what you would normally spend on a days commute or your morning coffee, this will add up and could be the difference between a family eating or going without.

I will be adding a donation on a week by week basis as long as this continues.

If you are able to donate, please don't forget to add gift aid!

Thank you.
Title: OSS Delivery - Donate the equivalant of a daily Coffee or Commute

Description:
Christmas is a perfect time to highlight the mission of Kirkcaldy Foodbank that nobody in the Kirkcaldy area goes hungry during a time of crisis and that everybody shares what they have.

The local press highlighted only last week that the foodbank is at risk of collapse if support is not found to cover shortfalls in funding. The foodbank is a vital lifeline to people and families in crisis across the Kirkcaldy area. Every month over 1000 food parcels are given out as demand grows on the run up to Christmas.

Please help us to support them to ensure nobody goes without this Christmas.

Title: Eat out to Help Out - Pay it Forward

Description:
I believe that MPs are elected to speak for the people, but our MPs do not seem to be listening. Poverty can affect anyone, and in a time of national crisis such as this pandemic it is affecting more and more families.

Last year, food banks in The Trussell network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. This was before Covid-19.

MPs are paid Â£80k per year, it has been reported they are to receive a Â£3k payrise, they claim expenses and on top of this they can earn money through consultancy work and other jobs - but the people they are paid to represent are struggling.

The premise of this campaign is simple:

  • Donate just Â£2 to The Trussell Trust to support their national food bank network and provide food to those in need.
  • By donating you are sending a message to our MPs that they do not speak for me, every donation is your voice to make them listen.
  • If you feel able to donate more, it is up to you.

Itâ€™s not right that people canâ€™t afford the basics. With your help, we can support food banks, and as a nation, tell our MPs that we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

https://www.trusselltrust.org/

https://www.parliament.uk/about/mps-and-lords/members/pay-mps/

https://fullfact.org/economy/poverty-uk-guide-facts-and-figures/

https://www.endchildpoverty.org.uk/

Title: Alex's Ncs fundraiser Ward

Description:
The Brick's aim is to eradicate homelessness and poverty in our community. They support homeless people, those facing homelessness, and people experiencing crisis or poverty in the Wigan borough. People who are marginalised by society, who can, with support, become independent and contribute positively to their communities. Services include crisis intervention, housing and health support on behalf of the Council, a foodbank, social and employment training, and wide-ranging volunteering opportunities. They ensure no one in our community gets left behind.

From now until the 14th of December Lowri Beck is collection foodbank donations on behalf of The Brick.

Title: Lynda's Life

Description:
Lockdown Languages was initially created when the schools closed in mid-March and I wondered if I could put my Modern Languages degree in French and Spanish to any use.  I started off by offering to help friendsâ€™ kids with their home lessons. 

Since then, Lockdown Languages has taken a few twists and turns and Iâ€™m now also doing basic classes for adults and some boozy Zooms with groups who just want to learn a few words and have some fun.  I can manage very basic Italian too!   

There are also collaborative classes with friends whose skills are on a par with mine where we all prepare a short written piece to read and discuss new words and grammar.  

There are no fees.   Frankly, Iâ€™m not qualified and extremely rusty.  But if thereâ€™s a way of raising a little bit of money through this that would be amazing.  So if youâ€™ve enjoyed a class,  or have no interest in taking part but think the concept is fun, I would be delighted if you could chip in a little bit to support Foodbanks through the Trussell Trust.   Thank you, merci, gracias xx 

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. Description:
Iâ€™m running(and hiking) the date in January. 1KM on the 1st all the way to 31KM on the 31st. 496KM in total!

Our vision is for a UK without the need for food banks.We say this because itâ€™s not right that anyone cannot afford their own food. Thatâ€™s why we are working towards a just, compassionate future, where no one should have to use a food bank to get by.Our vision is ambitious, but we know that if we work together it is possible. We can create a future where nobody goes hungry, because nobody will allow it â€“ when we work Together for Change.#TogetherForChange
Title: Timothy's 496 challenge  page

Description:
Over the next few months, Iâ€™ll be cycling 2033km with 32448m of vertical climbing...but to maintain social distancing, Iâ€™ll be doing it all in my garage. 

Yup, Iâ€™ll be ticking off every Zwift route available, leading up to my final ride, riding the full length of the Prudential Ride London route - 173km long and 2496m up - in one go.

Iâ€™d already done 400km before I started this, but thereâ€™s still plenty to go. You can follow my progress here, on Strava, or on my social media accounts @thatcastrochap. Iâ€™ll also be streaming some of the longer rides, so that should be a laugh. Come and watch me suffer.

Title: Tour de Garage

Description:
For those who know me, I currently get very little sleep. This means I have come to rely heavily on chocolate and other delicious treats, just to get me through the day (alas, i don't like coffee, otherwise I'd be all over it!). 

My chocolate reliance has gotten a little out of hand and last week I ate so much I got a bit jittery and shaky. Definitely time to do something to combat my greediness and adopt a more healthy diet. And i thought, why not give up chocolate and do something more positive with my personal challenge? Raising money for the local food bank and being less of a greedy guts makes perfect sense to me.

Here's to raising money for those in need and for (hopefully) reducing my risk of an extra chin and flab role and diabetes!

Title: Liz's Christmas Doorstep Portraits

Description:
Endings and beginnings - letting go of the old year and breathing into the new. 

12 noon - 1pm UK time

This will be an active session using movement, Do-In and self-shiatsu. We will use shiatsu techniques to get connected with our own bodies and feel resourced, using acupressure points and movement. We will connect especially with the Large Intestine and Lung meridians to help us with letting go and breathing in.

2020 has been a year when poverty has become increasingly prevalent in the UK and more people are using foodbanks. This fundraiser will give a little back to the Trussell Trust to support people living in poverty.
Title: Endings and beginnings self-shiatsu class with Hannah Mackay

Description:
The Coronavirus is already having a hugely negative economic and social impact across the UK, whether thatâ€™s job uncertainty or self-isolation preventing many vulnerable people from buying the basic items they need.

As an education provider Bournemouth & Poole College wants to engage with our community to help raise awareness and funds to help people through these trying times.

We are working hard to ensure we have a real, positive impact on the lives of our local communities. We have the resources and the fantastic staff to help make it happen.

That is why we are joining FE colleges nationally in the FE Food Bank Friday initiative. Since the programme started on Friday 20 March many colleges across the country are pledging to take part.

As staff and students are now working and studying remotely, it is becoming difficult for staff and students to physically donate any items. That is why we have joined this fundraising campaign, which aims to raise Â£2,000 so that foodbanks can continue to operate despite social distancing taking place across the country.

About The Trussell Trust

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. Itâ€™s not right that people canâ€™t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange.
Title: FE Food Bank Friday

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Short version: Â£25 from 100 people, helps 100 families in their time of need. Just donating what you can AND also sharing this page can make a huge difference. I'll be living on Â£1/day for 6 days at the end of July.

Live Below The Line

Live below the line is a challenge from The Hunger Project. It is quite simply - live below the line for a given time period. Sometimes a day, sometimes 5.

The aim is to raise awareness of extreme poverty abroad, nationally and at home, and to raise funds.

The line is the world extreme poverty line, below which 1.2 billion people live. That's a mind boggling number. The line is Â£1 a day. Â£1 a day for food - all your food for one day.

Bringing closer to home: 13 million people live in poverty in the UK. 600,000 of those live in Greater Manchester - 1 in 4 people. 3.9 million children in the UK live in poverty. 91,000 of those are children - the majority have 1 or more parents in work.

These are the people that access foodbanks - over 1 million times in the past year. 1 million times when someone would go hungry instead.

They do this week in, week out, unrelentingly.

6 pounds, 6 days

As a result, I will live below the line for 6 days. That's the 5 days people normally do, with a day on top. I'll be doing this from Sunday 23rd July 2017 to Friday 28th July 2017.

Why Manchester Food Bank

It's on our doorstep. It's personal. 1 in 4 people in manchester are in poverty. No-one chooses poverty - poverty chooses them. Manchester Food Bank was seeded by the Trussel Trust, and supported by them as part of their national collective of foodbanks. 

Why am I doing this?

I'm doing this because I think modern society should be able to exist without people living on the borders of starvation. Many years ago I had to live on a similar budget to this, but I think things have become worse. I was lucky enough to be able to use education to lift myself out of that. Many people are not lucky enough to do that. In the absence of change, they need assistance.

I feel strongly that foodbanks should not need to exist, and that they are a failure of society. Until they're no longer needed, those using foodbanks need help.

Lastly, it's in essence to raise awareness and to try and do something positive that I couldn't do myself.

Why such a high target?

Because it matters. I've picked a figure that is achievable and would make a difference. Yes, it's a hard target, but if I get 1/2 way there I will have succeeded. Every level of support helps. Some baseline numbers: Â£10 buys a basket of food for an emergency food parcel, Â£25 buys a family 3 days of food. (Â£2/day is not luxury), Â£50 restocks supplies on the things the food back runs short of for 1 week

Which ever way you look at it, the target makes a difference.

  • Helps 100 families over a difficult period. Just 100 families. On average 400 people.?
  • Or it helps 250 people in a period of emergency
  • Or it helps the foodbank for a whole year to not worry about things they run short of.

No matter the actual amount raised though, it makes a difference.

Bear in mind:

  • How much do you spend on entertainment a week / a month? Can you go without that once?
  • Rather than a take away, can you cook at home instead?
  • If you're contemplating a new gadget, can you wait a month and instead donate 1/12th the cost?
  • As little as Â£1 helps, that seems like a little, but it can /literally/ be a day's food for someone.

You might not be in a position to help financially. I get that.

  • If you can't give, please share this page, this helps. Each time you share this page, you increase the chances of another Â£10 towards the goal.
  • Failing that, please add foods to a collection point. It goes directly to helping the same foodbanks.

Gift Aid

Please, PLEASE, please gift aid your donation if you can. It boosts the intake. it means that every Â£20 donated raises Â£25 for the charity - with the extra Â£5 coming from taxes you already pay - forcing the govt to do a tiny fraction of their part too.

Donate via text

You can also donate via mobile phone. Examples:
  • If you want to donate 5 days' food - Â£10 - you do this by texting "MCFB75 Â£10" to 70070
  • If you want to donate a day's food - Â£2 - you do this by texting "MCFB75 Â£2" to 70070

Practicalities

I'll track my progress here: https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/sparkslabs . I'll provide proof of costs here as well. The key practicality is that you can only eat foods you buy that week.

One common/small exception I've noticed is people allow themselves salt and pepper. (Since you buy those very very rarely, and use fractions of a penny if that if anything) But no spices, *nothing* else you might take for granted.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Help me help Manchester Foodbank Help 100 Families by living below the line

Description:
Our colleagues in our firm are participating in an epic challenge. The distance from our most northerly office, Oslo, to our most southerly office, Madrid, is 2966 km. We want to cover this distance by either walking, running, cycling, horse riding or even sailing on the weekends of 29th & 30th May and 5th and 6th June, 2021. You will be able to witness our heroic efforts here thanks to videos and livestreams that will be uploaded on those weekends. How can you help? You can show us your support by sponsoring our brave athletes to complete their target in km. Founded in June 2020, the Foundation has so far distributed 1,178m euros to COVID-related charities. The 15 beneficiary charities come from seven European countries.

At the Benelux office we will be riding the harsh final of the Amstel Gold Race classic, a ride of 75km with more than 1300 meters in elevation. 

In total we will be riding over 1,000km, the riders are: Alexander Craeymeersch, Benoit Petrarque, Christiaan Beunk, Daan van den Berk, Frederic Renard, Hans Pluijgers, Jan Pieter van Wijngaarden, Job van Breukelen, Karel Zoete, Loic de Smet, Maarten ter Horst, Matthias Maenhaut, Mathijs van Leijenhorst, Patrick Roquas, Peter Olofsen, Richard Withagen and Romain Kumps. In addition, Marcha de Boer and Tran Nguyen will do a hike in the Dutch mountains.
Title: Benelux - Kepler Cheuvreux's North-South Challenge

Description: The last few months have seen immense suffering and hardship from storms and flooding. However the outbreak of the Coronavirus has quite literally changed everyones lives and turned society upside down.However, The Salvation Army is resolute and strong and just as we did in the Spanish Flu pandemic, and during the bombing and the Blitz we will carry on, doing what we can to support people and communities in the ways that we can, within the Government guidelines.In true Salvation Army Spirit, our greatest strength is our flexible, responsive local presence. Right now, each of our 650 corps and community centres will know exactly what the most effective things are to do. We are not just responding to the virus impact in one or two ways, but dozens and dozens of different ways, from food banks to counselling, from supporting NHS isolation units to checking up on people who are living alone. In Carnforth we have chosen to work alongside existing support networks to support and protect our Community. Please give what you can to enable us to help as many people as possible!
Title: Carnforth Corps & Community 's Carnforth COVID Response

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.  I work for Teenage Cancer Trust and joined the South London Scrubbers as a volunteer in April to sew PPE scrub caps, masks, aprons, laundry bags and ear savers for the local NHS, care homes and foodbanks. This volunteer group has sewn over 3000 sets of scrubs plus thousands of other PPE items, and my fellow students from my adult education sewing class have also joined the project and are sewing away to help support all our carers during this time.

While sewing I am also trying to raise money for the charity I work for Teenage Cancer Trust that supports 13-24 year olds with cancer. We fund specialist age appropriate units, nurses and youth support coordinates nationally as well as running a range of support programs for young people with cancer. Description:
Sandra, or Mum to me (or Nana, Sister Bray and more often than not "Gobshite"), recently lost her brave battle with cancer. A battle that she faced with her characteristic no-nonsense attitude, an unyielding desire to win, and above all her sense of humor.

Since her passing on 14th November our family have received an
overwhelming level of love and support for Mum. Itâ€™s so humbling to know how much she means to so many people.

In lieu of flowers and in her memory, Mum requested that donations be made to St Francis Church foodbank â€“ Ran by The Trussell Trust which runs a network of over 400 foodbanks, giving emergency food and support to people in crisis across the UK.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving â€“ theyâ€™ll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, theyâ€™ll send your money directly to the charity and make sure Gift Aid is reclaimed on every eligible donation by a UK taxpayer. So itâ€™s the most efficient way to donate - the family raises more in Mum's memory, whilst saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

Mum was adamant her legacy should be something positive and so picked this local charity to support, she wanted to make a difference to people in needâ€¦ and we all know she always gets her way. :)

Sarah (the good child) x
Title: In loving memory of Sandra Bray

Description:
In 2018 I ran three marathons in three months, this year I will go one race further and I am running four races in three months. 

I will be following a special space aged scientifically formulated couch to marathon 5 month training plan which entails pounding around Middleton, Heywood or Rochdale until I am absolutely knackered. This will also be supplemented with a tri-weekly Olympic style rigorous aquatic regime of keep on swimming until my arms and legs give up. If you see an extremely tired, overweight mess who is struggling badly in a yellow jacket in these areas, it's most probably me. As usual, extremely poor efforts of a physical training masterclass will be reported back to my Diary Of A Rotund Forrest Gump Facebook page HERE >

https://www.facebook.com/FourMarathonFurlong/

On a more serious note, both foodbanks work extremely hard for those that have fallen on hard times and help those that need support the most. They are a credit to our community. Please give if you can to these two very worthy causes.

Due to Covid the original marathons have been cancelled so the first run is now to be at Heaton Park in October. The second race is at Tatton Park in November.


Money to be collected by Inspire and split between Heywood and Middleton Foodbanks.

Thank you for reading my page.

Title: HELEN's Dry January

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

When I came across the work that Little Village do I was stunned. Itâ€™s like a foodbank, but instead of food, it offers essential items like clothing, books, toys and baby equipment to parents in need, right across London. Itâ€™s frankly alarming that thousands of families need to rely on â€˜hand me downsâ€™ and the good will of other people to barely survive. This is just for essential items. I am saddened that in this day and age tiny babies and children under 5 are going without the most basic of items right here in London, items I completely took for granted when I was pregnant and during the early years of my children growing up. 

Can you imagine trying to breastfeed your little one without any breast pads to pop in after? Or not having enough nappies? Imagine not being able to clothe your children appropriately. Imagine trying to entertain your smallest children without the most basic of toys or books? 

This is where I think I can make a small difference. As part of my ongoing #asyouaremotherhood campaign across Instagram and Facebook, I'm celebrating and highlighting those of us (silent) women heroes, who everyday, do all we can to provide for our children and to be the best mothers we can be.

There is such a pressure for us mums to be perfect: we all strive for perfection everyday when the reality is, perfection doesn't exist.

We all worry, are anxious about whether we're doing the right thing for our unborn baby or the children we already have. We can look at others and think they're somehow doing it better than us, and feel like we've failed.

We must change our attitudes and change the way we treat ourselves.

That's why I'm giving away a limited number of mother and baby photoshoots to celebrate how amazing and unique we are as mothers, how we ARE doing all we can to help our children. 

And that our best is good enough. We are good enough.

Through this project, I can ask pregnant women and mums to come into my studio, get a fabulous photoshoot to show how fabulous they are (just as they are without the need for fancy or OTT props) - and spread the word about self-love and acceptance. 

And then in return all I'd ask is a contribution to Little Village.

This is my way to give back to some struggling families on my own doorstep? Little Village does just that; giving the gift of the most basic but essential things to babies and children who really need them. 

As their website says: â€œIt takes a village to raise a child - this is especially true in London where we often feel alone as parents.

â€œLittle Village is a gift from one family to another, passed on with love.â€

If I ask each of my photography clients to donate, say, just Â£20 to this cause, I would forgo my booking fee of usually Â£95. Clients could of course donate more if they wish or were able to, but I thought this would be an excellent start. 

So if you're keen to book a Maternity or Baby photoshoot with me, Iâ€™ll direct you to this page where you can donate what you can and then weâ€™ll see what happens. Things will snowball from there. Letâ€™s do this together and be part of something hopeful to change the world we live in, right on our doorsteps.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

Description:
A 24 hour winter walk on the Shortest day. Winter Solstice

People need our help now more than ever before.

Derek Allan will be walking around Druridge Bay Country park for a total of 24 hours to help raise money and collect food for people in need.

As always he would welcome company if anybody would like to join him for a "Socially distanced" lap. Footprints regulars... Ellie and Shaun will be supporting him as much as they can.

This is taking place on 21st December (The shortest Day - Winter Solstice)  10am - 10am 

The footprints for others team will be on site with a table set up to take food donations. This will be at the first carpark on the left as you enter the Country Parks beside the Swan Seat.  (Gate for cars closes at 4.00pm but can still be accessed by foot)

These food donations will be taken to Amble Foodbank and will be distributed to those in need in the local area of Druridge Bay. Any cash donations will go to The Trussell Trust who organise foodbanks nationwide.

**Please note that Social Distancing rules must be adhered to if joining us to making a donation.** 

Amble Foodbanks preferred donations - Pasta, rice, breakfast cereals, tins of meat any kind, meatballs , stew, curry etc, soup, , tins of rice pudding, custard, fruit, tins of veg, potatoes, carrots, peas etc, pasta sauce, cooking oil, toilet rolls, biscuits, diluting juice, shower gel, shampoo soap, wash up liquid, UHT milk, tuna, beans , coffee and tea.  Anything gratefully received. xxx

In the last month FareShare has:-    

  • Almost 500 new charities signing up to get food, 80% of them providing food parcels
  • Most of the existing 11,000 charities are now delivering food to
    people's doorsteps or create safe collection points
  • There has been a 90% increase in the amount of food sent out by
    FareShare
  • There is a significant increase in demand. The number of charities who
    have applied to receive food from FareShare has more than tripled in the last
    month
  • Nine regional centres have needed and secured additional warehouse space 

Some of the amazing charities FareShare are supporting:
