Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

 These are very uncertain trying times, and I know there are plenty of people out there who currently rely on the fantastic service their local food banks have to offer. Why am I doing this? Well, I've seen similar things happening elsewhere and whilst trying to find ways to help out locally I figured that sticking to what I am good at would be the best way to go. I enjoy photography, itâ€™s a passion of  mine. Iâ€™m also what youâ€™d call a social butterfly, so the two tend to go hand in hand.

During the current lockdown situation and the governments advice on social distancing I wanted to somehow document this on my one walk of the day, but also being productive. I'd like the opportunity to photograph you and your family from a safe distance, on your doorstep, pulling stupid faces at the windows, maybe doing cartwheels in the garden, what ever you're up for. And for just Â£5 you get a couple of photos to remind you of a time you're unlikely to ever forget and the Mid Cheshire Foodbank gets 100% of that fee. This isn't about work, more about keeping active and helping out. Thank you so much for your support and I hope to see you on my rounds. Much love to you all, Adam xx

Title: Jade's Charity Quiz Night

Description:
**** Update: We are absolutely humbled by the generosity of our colleagues for this amazing donation drive.  Our target was smashed within the first 5 days! We will be accepting donations until 2pm on Friday 11th December and since we have 11 days to go we thought weâ€™d stretch the target to Â£1500 and share this drive throughout Scotland. Teenagers are often not thought about for donation drives as the target tends to be younger children and the magic of Christmas, however our teens are in as much need. If you havenâ€™t donated and would like to make a real difference in someoneâ€™s life please take the time to support this cause. ****

Christmas and the holiday season can be such a magical time for us all - but for those less fortunate it can also be a time of great sadness.

While we all celebrate, some may find themselves in a position where they are not able to afford any gifts for themselves or their love ones, and join in on the festivities. This, accompanied with potentially a lack of food to go around, can make Christmas a real struggle.

That's why we've teamed up with Glasgow South East Foodbank. At the Glasgow South East Foodbank, they aim to provide those in need, with a Christmas / Holiday food hamper, some small gifts such as shower gels, and ideally a Â£20 gift card to help during the holiday season.

To promote this cause, an aid our own wellbeing, four of us from the team will collectively walk 100 miles within a week, all while working full time, juggling childcare needs and the monotony of the tier 4 restrictions. From Monday 30th November to Sunday 06th December Graeme Davidson, Joe Simmons, Louise McShane and Connor Johnston will be walking during breaks, meetings (where possible) or just up and down the stairs when we get free time to get that step count up. Support us by supporting this amazing cause.

With our donations this year, we can help give as many teens a Christmas, and give them something to look forward to. Something we all desperately need this year.

We ask that you please consider donating this year. Any donations at all will make a huge difference to a teen in need, and struggling families.

Thank you to you all!


www.glasgowse.foodbank.org.uk

foodbank@glasgowelim.org.uk

Glasgow SE Foodbank Registered charity number SC043981


* While we have teamed up with Glasgow South East Foodbank to provide presents to teens, we cannot confirm that all funds will go towards presents, some funds may go towards gift cards, or additional food supplies. This will be decided at Glasgow South East Foodbanks discretion.

Title: Department of Archaeology Winter Fundraiser

Description:
Thank you for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

During Lockdown, two of our pupils, Isaac and Matthias, decided to raise money for Cambridge City Foodbank by completing a sponsored cycle every day. We were so impressed by the boys' willingness to help others, that we wanted to support them in their fundraising.

During Healthy Lifestyle week from 15th-19th March, every pupil will be encouraged to complete The Grove Challenge. 

This involves going on a walk/run/cycle/scoot on as many afternoons as possible during the week and recording your distance each time. In addition to this, each class will be completing their 'Move for 15' run each afternoon in school. All distances travelled will be added together to see how far we can travel across the map of England in just one week. Let's see if we can reach France by next week! 

Thank you for your support and encouragement.

Description:
Thank you for visiting our JustGiving page and reading about our family Sponsored Cycle Ride.

During the lockdown we have decided to use our exercise time to raise money for The Cambridge City Foodbank.  Each morning, we are cycling laps of our local park and we hope to have cycled a family total of 500km by the end of the lockdown.  

Our total distance so far is 835 laps = 500km!!! (updated 11.4.21).

Please join us in raising money so that families in Cambridge can get food when they need it during these very difficult times.

Title: British Gas Gifts for Kids

Description:
I shall keep putting money in for as long as I don't shave my mohican off - PROMISE!

My son challenged me to grow a mohican/mohawk, following a discussion about how lockdown is an unusual opportunity for people to do odd stuff with their hair (in my case shaving my head at the start of pandemic...albeit that this may have been, aha, overdue).  I was actually trying to convince my son to get his hair cut...but it's backfired, (perhaps unsurprisingly with hindsight).

Anyway, the deal tabled is that each week that I continue to pursue this absurdity, I'll put a certain amount of money aside for a foodbank charity really in need of help during the lockdown. Of course I am increasingly follicly challenged, so there's a very real chance it won't work anyway (and bear in mind it's basically drawing attention to the least favourite of my features (make pattern baldness) - if it gets too bad and I bail on the plan I'll pay a penalty amount to said charity).

SO, WHO'S WITH ME?!! Can I get anyone else to buy into this ridiculous plan, and similarly grow a terrible mohawk - "Mohicovid" could be a thing? The next Movember?! (It clearly won't be). Perhaps there's a tiny chance that there might be some other brave adventurers ready to sacrifice their dignity for charity?! Go on. Please... 

Is this a sponsorship worthy escapade? I don't know? No-one likes a begging message. Would people be prepared to offer small amounts of hard-earned cash in return for my (and maybe others') ongoing humiliation? Maybe?!! Go on - sponsor me!
Title: MOHICOVID - sponsored lockdown mohawks for charity!

Description:
Dear Fellow Darwinians,

As you are aware, many people in the UK are currently facing financial hardship. We are thus raising funds for the Cambridge City Foodbank and would appreciate your additional donations and support. While our event has allowed you to connect with your loved ones and hopefully meet some new faces, food insecurity has been on the rise, we hope that you can contribute to this cause! With love,

Chanon and Maya
Title: DCSA Valentine Walks

Description:
Hi everyone, I'm Maisie, the producer for Bristol PantoSoc's latest show - 'Farce from the Past'. Due to the current state of affairs, we haven't been able to put on our usual Easter panto in the theatre (BOO), so we have instead taken to the internet to bring you our special brand of comedic shenanigans (HOORAY).

Ordinarily, we have a raffle to raise money for charity, and we didn't want to miss the opportunity to help out a worthwhile cause. As such, we're asking our audiences to donate a little something to the North Bristol Foodbank to help tackle food poverty in PantoSoc's home city.

Thanks for anything you can give, and we hope you enjoy the show!

Title: Lewisham Food Bank

Description:
What is good food?

  • No takeaway 
  • No greasy, fatty, fried or sugary food including candy, fizzy drinks, cake, ice cream, sausages (oh god), bacon (man what are you doing to yourself) or and I cant believe I am saying it but melted/american cheese.
  • Must contain minimum of two veg or fruit (I will have to google what this is but i'm sure I can get some somewhere) 

To some of you this will seem trivial, silly or just plain stupid but to those of you that know me (well you probably thought I was describing myself) I am known and have been known for a long time as having the worst diet of anyone people know. Today I had macaroni and cheese with bacon two ways, fried onion and egg for breakfast followed by a burger king double rodeo burger with fries and 9 chicken nuggets for lunch and dinner will consist of pizza, garlic bread and Camembert just to give you a picture of the scale of the problem we are dealing with here. Knowing me I will also likely have a small (not so small) bowl of Crave at around 11pm just to ensure I don't get hungry during the night. 

What if you cheat? How will we know?

  1. When at work I will be having my breakfast and lunch in the office so I can be observed. 
  2. Each meal I will photograph as evidence 
  3. I will be stabbed each day at the same time! By this I mean I will have my sugar levels check each and every day of the month before work having taken an average reading over the next 5 days to prove I haven't cheated when I get home. I will also photograph these results on weekends and maintain the pictures as proof. 

Why should I care?..........1,000,000+ People!

Simple answer really people are starving! Over 1 million people now rely on food banks in the UK in order to survive in this country. Now....just take that in for a minute; in one of the worlds top 10 economies we are allowing more and more people every year to fall through the net, these are children, adults, elderly, poor and sick people who are already suffering from poverty in a top 10 economy! 

So even if you don't care about the reason I am doing this think about the cause! Even Â£2.50 can provide enough ingredients to allow 1 person to attend an eat well for less course. Just Â£10 can help provide food for a whole family in need! 

For me? 

This is hard! Some of you will run, cycle, climb or jump off something for charity and I applaud you for it.......but this is something that will affect me every minute of every day. I haven't changed my diet in 15 years. If it was easy I would have done it already!

Finally entertainment:

You sadistic people will no doubt enjoy the selfies of misery, daily stabbing I will endure and joy of eating a burger king right under my nose so give what you can and lets see how much we can raise and don't forget every few Â£Â£s we raise will mean someone in our community is not going to bed hungry! 

Thanks!

Josh

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

My kids love Halloween trick or treating around Riverside View and it gets better every year! This year is different in so many ways but the kids have had enough taken from them. Lets keep the joy alive by decorating our houses as normal and also displaying a poster. Rather than trick or treating and giving out sweets, children can try and spot as many posters in windows/porches etc as possible. Our families remain safe and the children have a spooky trail to follow. How many posters will they spot? Plus, we can donate the money we would spend on sweets and treats to help those that have suffered during this difficult time. Win-win!

I have created the poster in black and white so that it can be coloured in by your little pumpkins (or yourself)! You can find the poster posted on the Riverside View residents only facebook group or left-click on the cover picture at the top of this page and save the image so you can print it out.

Description:
Share a Cuppa Comfort with someone in need of a food parcel this Winter.

The idea behind the #shareacuppa campaign is to do what we do best when times are tough and reach out with a big mug of metaphorical love for someone who really needs a cuppa.

For the price of a cuppa tea you could help ensure someone is fed this Winter.

5 Cuppas = 1 3 day food parcel for a family of 4

Food poverty is a critical issue here in Birmingham, and numbers are soaring of those in need. At Aston & Nechells Foodbank we are providing near double our YoY food parcel numbers and this is only going to increase as the Covid Crisis extends.

If you can share the price of a cuppa tea to help a hungry person today. Please do.

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our Baker Hughes JustGiving page.

To challenge ourselves and also support our local community we are setting out on a journey..

The aim collectively as a team, we will walk, run or cycle the equivalent distance from Newcastle upon Tyne to Sao Paulo via Houston and Niteroi, linking our 4 sites, over 16,000 kilometers. 

NCL to Houston - 7566 Km

Houston to Niteroi - 8085 Km

Niteroi to Sao Paulo - 386 Km

Locally we are already supporting the NHS by donating PPE so we wanted to support a worthy local foodbank which is located not far from our Newcastle Site as they need all the support we can give them during this difficult time.

The challenge is open to all and you can log your distance via the survey link here  http://surveys.ge.com/create/500122  add as many times as you like.

Thanks so much for your efforts and support.

Andy Mason

Title: Jill's University of Glasgow Law School Virtual #CakeDay

Description:
A new year brings a new challengeâ€¦

My team and I, plus the wider SOMT team under @Julie Smart at Barclays are going to collectively be virtually walking, running and cycling the distance from Teesside in the UK via the various  Barclays sites we are based at for work in the UK, to Pune in India â€“ almost 6,500 miles in total, this year. 

 

Why are we doing this? 

Two simple reasons:

  • Firstly, at a time when most of us are working from home, having something as a target that helps keep us all fit and healthy is really important for both mental any physical wellbeing.
  • Secondly, and really importantly to all of us, we have selected a number of charities that are aiming to help those in most  financial need through the pandemic with food provisions. These are all local to the sites in which we work - supporting the communities near our places of work is something we are
    all passionate about.

What would we like from you?

Obviously it would be great if you could give a donation of any amount to one of the charities, to support their great work (feel free to pick which ever you want or is closest to you), but if you cant, a simple cheer/like/word of encouragement would be just as appreciated to keep us on the virtual road to Pune (and maybe even motivate us to try the â€˜returnâ€™ journey)
Title: Craig's Teesside to Pune

Description:
From 1st February 2021 I will be jogging 90km in 60 Days to help families in need during these uncertain times for The Northern Devon Foodbank, supported by The Trussell Trust. This charity provided nearly 38000 meals to families in North Devon and Torridge during December. I am new to running but with your help, support and motivation I will achieve this! 

In the last year it has been so hard for millions of people emotionally, mentally and financially to the point families can't afford to put food on the table, myself included at the very start of this pandemic in March. A lot of us are in the same boat but sadly some are worse off than others which is why I want to do my part in giving to those who are struggling but I need your support. Any donation as little as Â£1 would make a huge difference and will be greatly appreciated. Thank you â¤ï¸

Help today, because tomorrow you may be the one who needs helping. ðŸ‘

Title: My BIG Charity Busk

Description:
Feeding 100 families for twenty days

Â£3 feeds one family for three days. Why not skip a coffee and help Amity and Zach to feed a family today? If they hit their target, with your help, 100 families in Lewisham will be able to access food for twenty days.  

Families in Lewisham are struggling to eat more than ever 

In 2013, one in five parents in Lewisham were skipping meals to ensure their children could eat. Almost one in ten children went to bed hungry most nights. Fast forward to 2019, and one in five children were still living in poverty, with Lewisham being the 48th most deprived local authority in the country. The pandemic has only made matters worse. One local foodbank serving 25-30 families before COVID-19 struck says it found itself feeding 5000 families last summer. 

The Great Clean Up

Lewisham is also one of the greenest parts of London, with the much loved Blackheath Common surely being the jewel in the crown of Lewisham's green spaces. However, litter on the common has become a growing problem during the pandemic, with people pushed outdoors by lockdown rules.

Cleaning the Heath to feed Lewisham 

Amity and Zach are two 14-year-olds from the Blackheath area, studying together at Sevenoaks School, who are ready to take on both of these problems, cleaning up the Common to raise money to feed Lewisham's hungry children. Please show them your support.   

Thank you

Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page. Donating if you can or even just sharing, if you can't, will make a huge difference.

Description:
I am fed up with a year of COVID, like everyone is, and I am struggling to be cheerful and positive this term! So I thought I might as well be miserable for a good cause - I have been dragging myself round a sloooow 2 mile run every day in Feb . I have pretty much managed it 
(minus 1 day with a bug and 2 long days in work on rota & with afterschool meetings) and have just 1 mile left to go tomorrow (28th). I am actually going to keep going in March, but it will be trickier as I'll soon have 70 min of commuting to fit in too. 

Do support me if you can. We are very lucky living in Morecambe with our prom and cycle tracks for fresh air and exercise (and the view - the town motto is 'beauty surrounds and health abounds'!), but there is plenty of deprivation and hardship too, especially this year. I would love to raise Â£250 on here for the FoodBank, and I plan to donate Â£250 of my own money to other local causes (TBC - probably split between More Music/ Ben's school), to make Â£500 which is 10xthe 50 miles I have run.

The Morecambe Bay Foodbank exists to help people in crisis by providing three days' worth of emergency food. We also provide school uniforms to children who need them in the area through our Uniform Project. Can you help us to raise funds to pay for a new van so that we can continue our work? Our old van is getting too small and we need a new one so that we can keep on working to feed and help people in the area.
Title: Sally's 50 miles in Feb

Description:
We are a group of young people from Falinge High School in Rochdale. Over the last few months we have been working with the Co-op College and Greater Manchester Youth Network to learn new skills and make a positive change in our community.  

We have chosen to make child poverty the focus of our social action as we were extremely shocked to learn how many children and families live in poverty in the UK in 2021.  

We are hosting an online event to engage with members of our community on this topic and raise funds for Manchester Food Bank.

Please give all you can to help end child poverty!

Description:
Thank you for reading. 

Those who know me know that my beard is pretty much my security blanket. I LOVE it. I am willing to shave it off for the first time in 8 years, to help raise money for my local food bank. Hopefully anything I manage to raise will go towards helping struggling families to manage a little easier during this unprecedented time we are all part of. 

If I can help one family have one less thing to worry about then it will all be worth it. Please give whatever you can, every little helps.

Title: Ross's Shaving for the first time in 8 years

Description:
There are lots of things we will miss about rowing this summer: training with our friends; getting an awesome AIO tan; the excitement of racing and representing our college! But there is one tiny bonus, and that is we will save a bit of money through not taking part in races next term. So we have decided as a club, why not do some good with that instead? We would like to encourage our members, if able, to donate the cost of a post training brunch, or a race entry fee, or a celebratory beer, and together we can raise some funds for the Cambridge City Food Bank. 

Last year Cambridge City Food Bank provided 9,243 3- day emergency food supplies to families in crisis across Cambridge. With the current Covid-19 situation, that need is undoubtably only going to increase. For more information on the vital work this group does please visit https://cambridgecity.foodbank.org.uk

Description:
CAN comedy have taken on the mission to raise money for this very worthwhile course.

Throughout December will be be raising funds at all our gigs as well as making a contribution ourselves to ensure we can do our bit to stop families in hardship going hungry this Christmas 

Black Country Food Bank helps vulnerable individuals and families in

crisis through the provision of 3 days emergency food supplies while a
longer-term solution is developed. The services we provide have an enormous
impact on the people who use them, giving them an important breathing space at
a time of great need.

Started in June 2006, we are a Christian-based

charitable organisation set up to feed local people experiencing real hardships
by meeting their most basic need for food. Local people, churches and other
organisations in and around the Black Country are joining together to be part
of a project that makes a real difference to the lives of those in crisis.

Title: My Birthday

Description:
In this run up to Christmas, it should remain at the forefront of our minds the amazing and unfortunately necessary work that Stoke-on-Trent Food Bank do for the community.

2020 has been one hell of a year, and the Covid-19 crisis has only done more to exasperate the need within our communities for this vital
service. It is cold and bleak out there, and countless people are reliant on food banks to prevent hunger. 

Last yearâ€™s appeal was wonderful. We broke all expectations, and we have never been prouder of what our small community was able to achieve. Every little donation helps in this campaign, and we recognise that everyone is feeling some difficulty right now. We arenâ€™t out to smash last yearâ€™s sum (Â£1,342 after setting an initial target of Â£200!), as wonderful as that would be.

We just want to support our community, and do our part, and (as some more talented people have said) leave the world a little bit better than we found it.

Title: Villa Fans Sky Box Office Alternative

Description:
A year ago, I was the Labour Party's General Election candidate for Dudley South. During my campaign I talked to hundreds of local families, many of whom shared with me how difficult it is to make ends meet. One young mum, on a bitterly cold day, told me she only had 80p left on her electricity meter and another spoke about how much harder it is in school holidays when her kids aren't getting fed at school. 

This was a year ago.

Since then, Coronavirus is pushing more families into poverty.

There are over 2,000 children in receipt of Free School Meals in Dudley South and many thousands more across the Black Country more widely. I would like to raise some funds to help the local food bank support them and their families this half-term and beyond.

Thank you for your support
Title: Lucy's fundraising for the food bank

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

I am looking to raise money for West Lothian Food Bank because we cannot leave the most vulnerable people in our community behind, especially at this time of year. 

We have seen all over the news the debate regarding Free School Meals for children, which are thankfully being supported in Scotland. But the issue is wider and deeper. Food bank usage has continued to increase  alarmingly and further support is needed to help this vital lifeline continue to support the people who need it. 

We have a responsibility to the vulnerable people in our community. We have a responsibility to help those who have so very little, even if we ourselves only have a little more. Where I was brought up - no one got left behind. People look out for one another. That's what I am asking for today. 

If you can donate, I would be ever so grateful. No matter how little, everything makes a difference. If you could spare the price of a pint or a coffee that would be magic. If you can't donate, then please share, share, share!

Lets go, WestLo!

TLD xo

Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

As Iâ€™ve been in lockdown with two little ones Iâ€™ve had more time than ever to reflect on our situation and what lockdown would be like for those less fortunate. I myself have been in that position many years ago and remember how hard it was to ask for help. With the recession  hitting the UK hard and more and more families out of jobs every day, there is going to be an greater need for food banks and good will of people more fortunate to help support those that arenâ€™t. 

Iâ€™ve set up this page to raise as much money as possible for our local food bank especially as the need for food will increase as we approach the winter months and people will be forced to have to make the hard choice between spending money on food or heating. 

No baby, child, teenager, young person, adult, or elderly person should have to be making these choices. Our government should be doing more to help, but unfortunately thatâ€™s not happening. So we need to take matters into our own hands and help those that need it the most. 

Please give what ever you can, a little goes a long way if everyone can chip in â¤ï¸

Title: Icon Films Christmas Food Bank Appeal

Description:
This is the JustGiving Page set up in memory of Sharn Iona Hughes.

Sharn was an incredibly kind and generous person, who always put the needs of others before her own. She was a selfless member of the community and a born organiser. She will be greatly missed by her family, friends, her colleagues - past and present, and the organisations in which she was so extensively involved; including Gallt Melyd Church, Gwaenysgor Choir, Trelawnyd Women's Institute and the Dyserth Women's Institute for whom she was pivotal in  coordinating educational, cultural and charitable events.

Most recently, Sharn was involved in the process of organising deliveries of hampers to the local food bank in Prestatyn through the Women's Institute. We, her family and friends, would like to continue her legacy of tireless charitable work, and so we ask for you to make a memorial donation to this fund which will go to the Prestatyn & Meliden Foodbank in Sharn's honour. Your donation will go a long way in helping the most vulnerable people in society at Christmas in a year of such economic uncertainty for so many, with projections estimating a near doubling reliance on food banks between this year and the last.  This is what Sharn would have wanted.

Title: In memory of Sharn Iona Hughes

Description:
Everyone has their lockdown story. All of us will have had our tough times and down days. But for me its all relative.

When people ask how I am coping through the pandemic, I always say the same thing, "Can't complain, I have it better than many."

More and more people are finding hard to make ends meet, heat the house, feed the family and pay the bills. With winter upon us it is more important than ever that we support incredible local initiatives like Morecambe Bay Foodbank, making a real difference to local families, every single day.

I don't want to make this political (even if it is), or lament that we shouldn't need foodbanks (which we shouldn't), those arguments are for another day. Right now, our neighbours, our friends our families and our colleagues need a little help. If you enjoy the show tonight, please give a couple of quid if you can. Know that it makes a REAL difference to a local family... and don't forget to GIFTAID!

Thanks Andy x

Title: Vanessa's Get It Off!

Description:
The foodbank was there when we really needed it, it was an absolute lifeline.

We dont think anyone in our community should have to face going hungry. Thats why we work with over 100 professional frontline care organisations to provide three days nutritionally balanced emergency food and support to local people who are referred to us in crisis. Manchester Central Foodbank supports people in parts of Central, North, South, and East Manchester. We are part of a nationwide network of foodbanks, supported by The Trussell Trust, working to combat poverty and hunger across the UK.

Money raised for our charity at this year's Great Manchester Run will go towards sustaining and expanding our services, meaning we are closer to reaching everyone who needs us.

Title: Callum's 100k in 10 Days

Description:
On Monday 11 May starting at 1300 hrs we will attempt a 24hr 417-mile indoor cycling charity challenge in aid of Morecambe Bay Foodbank. We will take our turns to try and make the distance on Zwift! We aim to circumnavigate the Irish Sea.

Stage 1 - Heysham to Liverpool 66.2m    

Stage 2 - Seatruck route from Liverpool â€“ Dublin 136.9m

Stage 3 - Dublin to Warrenpoint 72.4m    

Stage 4 - Seatruck route from Warrenpoint back to Heysham141.5m

We have decided to do this challenge to raise money for the Morecambe Bay Foodbank. 417 miles is a long way and it will be touch and go if we can make it in 24 hrs. The Morecambe Bay Foodbank has always done amazing work but their efforts during the COVID-19 have been incredible.

The Morecambe Bay Foodbank exists to help people in crisis by providing three days' worth of emergency food. They also provide school uniforms to children who need them in the area through our Uniform Project. You help to raise funds to pay for a new van so that they can continue their work. Their old van is getting too small and they need a new one so that they can keep on working to feed and help people in the area.

Thank you for your generosity,

Alistair, Meg, Will & Bess Eagles (Google the dog will be watching!)

Description:
Christmas is a magical time for us at Jam Jar. As a family, we're surrounded by people we love and the magic of it all literally beams out of mini jam jar all the way through December. As a business we get to style some incredible events, and be surrounded by all that sparkles and shimmers. Sadly though, we know that many families on our own doorstep won't have the same feelings about Christmas. The dread of where to find the money for food shouldn't happen to anyone, at any time of year, but especially at christmas. As a mom, a wife and a business, I want to make a little difference to some of the families who need a bit of extra help this year.

I will be donating to the Black Country Food Bank on Tuesday 3rd Decemeber, and anything we raise on this page, I am aiming for Â£100 which I will match and buy additional donations. You can also leave donations at the studio too.

Please do share! The more of us who make a small donation will make a big difference.

Thanks guys xxx

Description:
WE SMASHED THE TARGET! Thank you so much everybody :) As a reward I will host the replay on my website for a week :) 

http://linuxbrit.co.uk/djpc.html

There are people going hungry in our local community every day, and the issue has been hugely exacerbated by COVID-19. Donating even a small amount could help a family in dire need. Or dig deep and see them through the summer!

I'm hosting a DJ set live on twitch (twitch.tv, it's a free live streaming platform you can watch on your mobile device, laptop or smart tv) on Wednesday July 8th from 19:00-20:30 BST and will ask for donations in return - think of it as your admission ticket. 

I taught myself how to do this the year before last, so I'm only an enthusiastic amateur - I may even embarrass myself! Either way it should be a fun 90 minutes!


We're calling it: Go big and stay home!

So let's turn the volume up, have a virtual house party, let our hair down and maybe even crack open a beer (or your favourite non alcoholic beverage) or two!

Even if you can't make it please think about supporting this important cause.

Joining instructions:

The URL is: https://www.twitch.tv/djtomgilbert 

You might want to create a twitch account if you don't have one, then you can subscribe to notifications when the channel airs. You can watch on phone/ipad/laptop or even cast it to your smart TV if you have one!

If I get disconnected (rural ADSL) I will rejoin within a few minutes so just refresh the twitch page. 

Tom.

â€œThe foodbank was there when we really needed it, it was an absolute lifeline.â€

We donâ€™t think anyone in our community should have to face going hungry. Thatâ€™s why we provide three daysâ€™ nutritionally balanced emergency food and support to local people who are referred to us in crisis. We are part of a nationwide network of foodbanks, supported by The Trussell Trust, working to combat poverty and hunger across the UK.

Title: Zoe & Mark's Wedding

Description:
I am organising a food drive and fundraiser for the Cambridge City Food Bank. Winter can be very difficult for those in our communities who are struggling, and the holidays can exacerbate that. The Food Bank is seeded by the Trussell Trust and provides food, sanitary and household supplies, and meter cards for gas and electricity to people in need. Food bank use is at an all-time high in the UK and your donations of food and money will go a long way. This winter, help people who are forced to decide to 'heat or eat', and bring some holiday comfort to people in need! Here's how you can help:

1. Donate food. If you are based in the Department of Archaeology, please take part in our food drive. There is a box in the coffee room for supplies and updated shopping lists from the Food Bank alongside it.

2. Donate money, either at the Department reception or using this page.

You can get more info about the Cambridge City Food Bank here: https://cambridgecity.foodbank.org.uk/

Thank you for your donations!

During June the Barclays private cloud team us getting together (virtually of course) to help a local foodbank, the Trussell trust â€“ Manchester branch. They are experiencing a large increase in demand for their services combined with a fall in donations due to covid 19.  Although we are all working from home for the foreseeable future and canâ€™t get together to do the usual cake sales, fun runs and other fundraising events we are all coming together as a team to do a virtuall commute and make a difference.

How do I get involved I hear you say!!! Missing your commute???? I thought so!!!!

Description:
Two lads who don't like running in the cold, have set a challenge to knock over 100km each in January. **Due to the amazing generosity shown by everyone we have agreed to up our distance target to 125km each.**

We came up with the idea over Christmas as we have been keen to help out foodbanks in the local community for a while now. We'll be raising money for The North Bristol Foodbank. In the UK, more than 14 million people are living in poverty â€“ including 4.5 million children. Which is a frightening statistic, no one should go hungry. 

We wanted to raise money for this charity as there are people in our local community who need our support now, more than ever. We are currently going through a global pandemic which is creating extremely challenging times for all. A few pounds donation could make a serious difference to those who need vital meals.

The North Bristol Foodbank

"We donâ€™t think anyone in our community should have to face going hungry. Thatâ€™s why we provide three daysâ€™ nutritionally balanced emergency food and support to local people who are referred to us in crisis. We are part of a nationwide network of foodbanks, supported by The Trussell Trust, working to combat poverty and hunger across the UK."

Even a few pound will make a huge difference to the Foodbank.

- Sam 25km done out of 100km

Thanks for all your support, means a lot to us!

Title: David Webster's Birthday

Description:
The Struggle

If life is like a bike ride then the last year would be The Struggle. 

Known as one of the toughest routes in the UK - The Struggle is a gruelling 108 mile challenge up some of the steepest hills in Yorkshire. Itâ€™s the kind of ride only taken by that odd group of people who actively seek out suffering - extreme cyclists. Donâ€™t ask me why Iâ€™m one of these strange breed of subhumans, as Iâ€™m really not sure, but for some reason I find myself constantly dragging myself out of bed in the frosty, early morning half light to push pedals round and around. 

The last year has been really, really hard for everyone in some shape or form but there are people who have found it harder than others. There is a growing number of people that have not even been able to access the most basic necessity of life - food.  Since the start of the pandemic in March 2020 there has been nearly a 50% increase in people needing Foodbanks in my hometown of Leeds. Although we may be seeing light at the end of the tunnel in terms of easing of restrictions and a return to â€˜normalityâ€™ in the city the economic effects of the crisis will be long lasting and continue to be devastating for huge numbers of people.  

Leeds South and East and North and West Foodbanks manage 20 distribution centres across the Leeds area and have provided essential food supplies for more than 40,000 vulnerable people across the city.  The Foodbanks are seeing a massive increase in clients accessing their services who have been affected by the crisis including people whoâ€™ve lost their job or source of income. There are also people who have suffered domestic violence and worsened mental health. People who find life a daily struggle. 

The increased demand for the Foodbanks' services has resulted in an ongoing challenge for funds to feed the growing number of people that need assistance. I know itâ€™s been tough for everyone but there are many people out there who urgently need emergency food.  Your donation will directly contribute to a fantastic organisation and network that makes a real difference. 

Struggling On Togetherâ€¦

Leeds Foodbanks 


Just to clarify - 
Foodbanks are a nationwide initiative organised individually at local level. The Justgiving funds raised on this page will go directly to Leeds South and East Foodbanks and will then be evenly distributed with Leeds North and West Foodbanks.

Title: Alexis's 45 Burpees

Description:
UK-based recruitment firms Harris + Co and Goodall Brazier are joining forces to complete the enduring â€˜Route 66 Challengeâ€™ throughout February, in a mission to give something back to those in need during the third lockdown in England.

Long-standing friends Toby Harris and Conor Firth, who lead firms Harris + Co and Goodall Brazier respectively, typically compete in the North American executive search market. Next month, however, they will be working together in the name of charity, in order to help those less fortunate.

Their overarching goal is simple. With 33 members of staff from both businesses taking part, they hope to raise as much money as possible by pushing their bodies to the limit, as well as encouraging other companies to get involved and support the cause in any way they can.

What is the â€˜Route 66 Challengeâ€™?

The Route 66 Challenge is the ultimate test of fitness, endurance and resilience. Over 28 days, the brave participants will be required to run, walk or cycle approximately 3,940km, which is the length of Route 66, working out at around 5km per person per day.

This will, of course, be no easy challenge, but the team are confident that they can rise to the occasion and fight through the pain as they seek to provide support for those who need it most in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic.

The idea to base the challenge around the distance of Route 66 was conceived by Jacob Scott an employee at Goodall Brazier, who wanted to highlight the connections between these UK businesses and their US operations.

The challenge begins on Monday 1st February and will end on Sunday 28th February. As mentioned above, the team will be able to complete the distance by walking, running or cycling. Regular updates will be posted on both company LinkedIn pages, and each athlete will be noting their progress as they attempt to smash their target.

Why is the challenge taking place?

While the Route 66 Challenge will be a fantastic team-building opportunity that promotes unity collaboration between two businesses, there is a very real issue that lies at the heart of it.

The coronavirus pandemic has thrown up challenges for everyone; many people have struggled massively, including experiencing financial problems, being made redundant from work and suffering from loneliness and depression as a result of not being able to see their loved ones.

In particular, mental health has been a particularly poignant issue during this crisis. According to the Centre for Mental Health, approximately 10 million people in the UK (almost 20% of the population) will need new or additional mental health support as a result of COVID-19.

While statistics like this are difficult to digest, they serve as extra motivation for the team to go above and beyond, committing themselves to the cause to help those who are less fortunate. If they can do their bit to give back to others, then this challenge will all be worth it and more.

Speaking on the importance of being able to help others, Toby Harris, Managing Director at Harris + Co said: â€œI gave Conor a ring one evening and we both agreed that it was the perfect time to do something like this. While weâ€™re all in lockdown again, there arenâ€™t a great deal of fundraisers or charity events happening, so we wanted to do as much as possible.â€

â€œWeâ€™ve had a fantastic start to 2021, and like many others, were focused on survival throughout last year. Now we have got through that period, we feel in a strong place as a business, and we want to help those who are struggling day in day out. Weâ€™re incredibly grateful to be in this position, and we want to help those who are struggling. The challenge is going to be tough, but we cannot wait to get started and make a real difference during this difficult period.â€

Conor Firth, Managing Director at Goodall Brazier, said: â€œWith so many people having their lives turned upside down during the coronavirus pandemic, it only seems right that we should do something to help. Toby and I are always looking for ways in which we can give back to local and wider communities, and weâ€™re delighted that our employees have stepped up and put their names forward for this challenge.â€

â€œItâ€™s a brilliant opportunity for us to stay physically and mentally active during this lockdown, as well as being able to raise money for some fantastic causes. Bring on Route 66!â€

How you can get involved

While the brave volunteers at Harris + Co and Goodall Brazier will be taking on the challenge, there are so many ways in which you can get involved to support them. If you run a business that has managed to survive this pandemic and you want to show your support in helping those in need, you can contact Toby or Conor directly on LinkedIn to find out more. 

Perhaps your team could run the length of Route 66 also to complete a round-trip, or even take on a brand new challenge of your own? As long as weâ€™re all united in our efforts, we can achieve great things!

Likewise, if you are part of a charity, or know of any worthy causes that need some additional support right now, please do not hesitate to reach out. The aim of this challenge is to help as many people as possible, and your support in helping do that would be welcomed.

The team will be updating everyone with their progress on LinkedIn, as well as on our dedicated fundraiser page, which will be live this week.

Both Harris + Co and Goodall Brazier would like to thank you in advance for your support. 

Bring it on!

Title: Our Huddle of Hope

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

We're in the grip of an international emergency and all of our lives have changed. We're facing new challenges, and restrictions, and it can get tough for us all at times, in different ways. With increased financial insecurity for many, many more people right now will be finding themselves in food poverty, and will be turning to the Foodbanks to help get them through this most difficult of times.

Skinner & T'witch have set up a Pick n' Mix Online Social Club on Facebook, as a place for other artists and ourselves to share our music and find a new audience; for viewers to find entertainment and hopefully feel less isolated; and a place to raise money for the Foodbanks.

In addition to the marvellous home videos that artists will be posting on the Online Social Club page, we (Skinner & T'witch) will be hosting weekly events on Sunday nights from 7-9pm UK (2-4pm US ET/Mondays 5-7am AUS ET). This will include fortnightly singarounds and fortnightly artist showcases (in rotation), and live sessions from Skinner & T'witch. 

Please donate whatever and whenever you can. Every little helps. Every Â£1 matters. Thank you so much for your support with this.

The previous situation with Leeds' Foodbanks (now exacerbated by the current crisis) was, as follows: 'Several issues have resulted the rise in demand, but...changes in benefit payments are the main reason people resort to using food banks...around 50 to 60 per cent of clients use food banks for this reason...Much of this is due to the move to Universal Credit, which can mean weeks without payment for some claimants...It is also because of changes to tax credits and other entitlements which working families make use of. People on low incomes because of zero-hours contracts and part-time work are also frequent clients...along with those suffering debt - often because of gas and electric bills. Other reasons also contribute to peopleâ€™s need for food banks, such as those who are having to escape domestic abuseâ€™.

Donate at any time via: www.leedsnorthandwest.foodbank.org.uk

www.leedssouthandeast.foodbank.org.uk

Stay safe, folks! Together, we'll get through this!!

Title: Let's Spread Some Cheer

Description:
This fundraising page is something we as a family have wanted to do for quite some time. With the Covid pandemic hitting the world in 2020 it has caused us to reflect even more so on how many things we are so very blessed to receive at Christmas time, but perhaps don't "need". We are struck when we look around us at so many other people who are in much more need than us. 

Therefore, rather than receiving an overwhelming amount of lovely gifts at Christmas this year, we would instead like to invite our friends and family to donate to Leeds South & East Foodbank who are partnered with The Trussell Trust to further their works in providing meals to local people who are in crisis. Supporting a local Foodbank is something we feel strongly and passionately about as we believe this will make a much bigger difference in not just ours but other people's lives and in general, working to combat poverty and hunger across the UK. 

If you could kindly donate any amount of money you might have spent on us this Christmas to our chosen charity instead, this will go a long way and mean the world to us this Christmas time. We ourselves as a family will too be contributing and would like to thank you for taking the time to read this and help out where you can. If you would like to learn more about the charity, you can click on their icon above which will take you to their page.

Last but not least, Merry Christmas from the Kwoks.

Description:
Charitable giving is an important part of who we are at Enable. Last year we managed to raise an amazing Â£3,100 for the Stratford-upon-Avon Foodbank, and we have decided to support them again this year as part of our 2021 "Cause of the Year".

This year our cause is homelessness and rough-sleeping, and we're pleased to support the Foodbank in this as they look to move their HQ to the upcoming Fred Winter Center in Stratford-upon-Avon. (Read more here https://stratforduponavon.foodbank.org.uk/2019/09/05/stratford-foodbank-reveals-plans-for-new-home/). 

This year as a company we're collectively running 5,270 miles (the distance between Stratford-upon-Avon to San Francisco) and you can pledge to sponsor us per mile by emailing charity@enable.com.

We have identified other charities we're supporting this year, and you can find their fundraising pages here:

https://uk.virginmoneygiving.com/EnableCauseOfTheYear2021

https://www.gofundme.com/f/enables-cause-of-the-year-2021

Description:
Hello from Adam and Remy of the Leeds Conservatoire Popular Music and Songwriting team!

We are asking you to join us in raising money for Leeds South and East Foodbank. 

Leeds Conservatoire is a creative community that we believe can be a part of something positive in this time of crisis. Communities coming together behind a common cause and goal is now more important than ever. While sticking to government guidelines, it's also really important to look after our physical and mental health by staying active where possible. 

Remy and Adam are committing to each running a half-marathon starting at 12pm on 20th March 2021 and are looking for more 'Team LC Run Challenge' members. 

You can support this by sponsoring us here and/or by running and fundraising yourself, like the hero we know that you are. As Rachel Dawes (2005) famously declared in Batman Begins: 'It's not who you are underneath, it's what you do that defines you'. Consider that a call to arms (and legs). 

We invite any and all members of the Leeds Conservatoire Pop and Songwriting community to join us by also completing a run at 12pm on 20th March and encouraging people to donate money via this page.

This is about covering as much distance and raising as much money as we can as a team. We will not be counting or comparing times, so just go at your own pace! 

You may choose to run any of the following distances:

4 miles

6 miles 

10 miles 

13.1 miles (half marathon) 

Sign up by emailing at this address: adam.martin@lcm.ac.uk 

In your sign up email, please tell us:

- Your full name

- Your chosen distance (from the list above) 

- Where you are running (town/city)

We will then add your name to this page so that the world
can see your amazing efforts. 

We will also be in touch with more exciting information and
updates as we approach run day. We really hope people can get behind this effort and support Leeds South and East Foodbank whilst helping each other to stay healthy and active. 

Remy and Adam 

THE LIST:

Remy Martin, 13.1 miles (Guildford, Surrey)

Adam Martin, 13.1 miles (Leeds, West Yorkshire)

Isaac Middleton, 4 miles (Lancaster)

Ashleigh McHugh, 10 miles (Leeds, West Yorkshire)

Title: Rhona & Kevin's Wedding

Description:
UPDATE 1st March

Dear all, 

Thank you so much for your kind donations so far! We are delighted to hit our initial target of Â£500 so quickly and have now increased this to Â£1000! In terms of progress, we have completed grade 2 and 3 exams (waiting for the results from ABRSM) and are now working on grade 4 repertoire. If we complete the challenge earlier than planned, we will attempt to go up to grade 6 by December! We will continue to update you as we go along in the coming months. Please do continue to check out our progress @shrewsburyhighschoolmusic on Instagram. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Mr Deakin and Mr Bunn are the Senior and Junior Directors of Music at Shrewsbury High School, GDST. One cold December evening late in 2020, they said to each other: "how cool would it be to learn a brand new instrument from scratch and try and get to say...grade 5 or 6 in a year?! We could set a challenge and do some fundraising!" Mr Bunn has been keen to learn the clarinet for many years, as other members of his family also play this instrument. For Mr Deakin, it has been a life-long dream to learn how to play the cello as it is one of the most beautiful instruments. But then he realised that he didn't want to have to carry a huge case around everywhere, so he decided to learn the violin instead...

...  

Anyway, after 6 weeks of scratching/scraping/squeaking/squawking our way through our new challenge (whilst both slightly regretting those optimistic words, said after 17 cups of coffee on a long day of recording for Carol Service 2020), we are both preparing to take our grade 2 exams in March 2021! We are aiming to achieve grade 5 on our new instruments by the end of the calendar year, in the winter exam season sometime in December. As well as this being a personal challenge, we are raising money for Shrewsbury Food Bank at Barnabas Church Centre, Shrewsbury SY3 7DN, to try and help some of the most vulnerable members in our community during Christmas 2021. The past 12 months have been difficult for everyone, but winter - and particularly Christmas - represent the most challenging period of all for many, and we would love to give our support during this time... 

We are aiming to raise as much money as possible throughout 2021, with a view to submitting our donation at the start of December to aide Barnabas throughout the Christmas period. We would absolutely love to surpass our target of Â£500 and would be very grateful for any amount of support you could give us - big or small - towards hitting this goal. We will be posting regular updates, vlogs (for your amusement and entertainment) and exam certificates (well, hopefully!) to keep you up-to-date with our progress throughout the challenge.

Thank you so much in advance for your support.

With best wishes,

Mr Deakin 

Mr Bunn
Title: Mr Deakin and Mr Bunn run a Grade-5-athon!

CharityName: Watford Foodbank and Community Relief Trust
Description:
Watford Foodbank and Community Relief Trust

We provide emergency food parcels to help local people in need.


About Watford Foodbank and Community Relief Trust

Watford Foodbank is an independent registered charity working with local churches, agencies and community groups, to provide food parcels for people in need in the Watford area. We are part of the national Christian Trussell Trust network of foodbanks. We also operate a debt advice service.



www.watford.foodbank.org.uk

info@watford.foodbank.org.uk

Watford Foodbank and Community Relief Trust Registered charity number 1150936

Description:
I will be leading a donation-based 45 minute relaxation class on Thursday 10th December, 6.30pm at Rhiwderin Village Hall - all proceeds will go to The Newport Food Bank!

Spaces are limited (as is the norm now!) so to book your spot for FREE, head to:

https://www.thefullyogamethod.com/book

And to donate to The Food Bank:

https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/thefullyogamethod

I will take you through one of my most favourite yogic practices - Yoga Nidra. Yoga Nidra guides you to a deeper state of consciousness whereby you are completely relaxed and rested, yet effortlessly aware. It is the coming back to the part of you that is always there, beneath all of the 'doing'. December, even in normal circumstances, can be over-whelming, let alone in the current climate and so this is the perfect practice to reset your nervous system and discover the art of relaxation! This may be the most peaceful way of raising money for a good cause :D

Everyone is welcome so send the link to anyone who may benefit from a Yoga Nidra practice. Wear your comfiest attire and bring as many blankets and cushions that you would like, an eye covering is also really nice too.
Title: Zoe's Yoga Nidra ~ Surrender to Rest

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Hi I'm Will 

Here's my story, on the 8th August 2020 weighing 18 stone and not being able to walk up small hills and suffering with depression decided I needed to do something about it, I had watched a documentary on pbs about the Western States 100 race. Were runners compete to run 100 miles through the mountains with a cut off of 24hrs.Then I had a crazy idea that I could run 100 miles in one go in 24 hrs and that is how I come up with the couch 100 miles in 12 months. Then being a Christian I had wanted to do a pilgrimage and got the idea to run the St Chad's way 92 miles from Chester cathedral to Lichfield and then home again. 

I chose Cannock food bank as the charity to do my Crazy scheme due to the important work that they do. I know first hand as I've been a volunteer in the past. 

So please give it must be worth a pound ðŸ‘

Thanks

CharityName: Pye Green Christian Centre - Cannock and District foodbank
Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page. 

By taking part in the #Santadash2020, you are helping to turn footsteps into foodsteps! No-one should go hungry, especially at Christmas! By walking, running, or cycling any distance, you can help ensure the foodbank has enough resources to support people over the festive period and further! 

How to take part:
1) Dress up in a festive outfit from a Santa Suit to a Christmas jumper

2) Walk, run, or cycle your chosen distance, 100m to 10K - remember every step counts!

3) Take a selfie, upload it on social media tag us in @ihlcannockchase, use the #Santadash2020 and nominate a friend

4) Donate to Cannock and District foodbank either through justgiving or a local drop off point: www.cannockdistrict.foodbank.org.uk/give-help/donate-food/

CharityName: Pye Green Christian Centre - Cannock and District foodbank
Description:
Thank you for visiting my JustGiving page; money raised through my Christmas song and Live stream will go to help the 45 charities, churches & organisations working under the umbrella of Cannock & district Food bank feed those in need.

Cannock & District Food bank has provided 30% more emergency food parcels this year than last... 4415 parcels from the 1st Jan - 30th Sept 2020.

These parcels go to individual, couples, children, families!

The Trussell Trust predict that this Winter, food banks are expecting to give out an emergency parcel every 9 seconds... 9 seconds!!

Please donate to help make sure we can feed everyone this Christmas!  And visit my FB page - www.Facebook.com/Telecastervision  -  to find out more about me and my music.

Lisa-Marie, who has experience of living in poverty said:

â€œI lost my job and was in a really bad way, struggling to meet the bills, feed the children, I was often going without food just so they ate. I got into quite a lot of debt and spoke to the food bank and they said they could help me.â€ via www.trusselltrust.org
Title: Give it up for Christmas campaign
